loan.name: C5668 Twimarubukene Group

texts.en:
Elie is 48 years old and married. Elie is the leader of a group called "Twimarubukene." This group is commonly known for selling rice, sugar, milk, etc. Elie and his team have been in this business for about four years. The business hours are from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day. Elie is in the middle, with the paper in his hand.
Elie and his team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses by purchasing rice, sugar and milk to sell. If successful, Elie and his team will hopefully earn more profit, which in turn will allow them to keep reinvesting for better financial stability. Additionally, they will be able to continue improving their families' lifestyle.

loan.use: to purchase rice, sugar and milk to sell.

loan.name: Reema

texts.en:
Reema is a 43-year-old woman from Baqa'a, Jordan, who is a mother of four.
Reema has a home-based project in which she makes henna "a kind of traditional paint used to make tattoos on hands and the body, used the most at wedding parties, especially for the bride" in addition to sewing wedding gowns.
Reemah is requesting a loan of 600 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase more materials for her project, such as henna ingredients and some cloth for the gowns.
Reema is looking to increase her family's living standard so that she can finance the education of her children.

loan.use: To purchase materials needed for her project such as henna ingredients and some cloth for gowns

loan.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana is a 47-year-old single woman. She has had a business weaving carpets for 25 years. Hana is a hard working woman, with a very good reputation and remarkable handmade carpets. She uses an old traditional cotton weaving loom to produce special rugs and carpets by request of several loyal clients who value her production.
Hana is a very responsible person. Although she's not married, she is responsible of taking care of her brother's children, because his business is not going on fine. That's why she applied for a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner -- to buy necessary sheep cotton to expand her business to cover the childrens' school fees and normal life requests.
What makes Hana's business unique is the tool she uses to produce these special carpets, since people working on such looms are very rare these days; almost vanished. Hana hopes to expand her business and develop it in the future, by teaching a few others this profession and opening and starting a small, professional business.

loan.use: To buy sheep cotton to expand her business.

loan.name: Jerusha

texts.en:
Jerusha is a married woman with three school-going children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.
Jerusha has operated a shoe-making shop for the past nine years; her potential clients are the local area community members. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of starting her own training school for young girls.
With this loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase leather, soles, and shoe gum for her business. She decided to join Yehu because their requirements are fair and products are customer tailored.

loan.use: To purchase leather, soles, and shoe gum for her business.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to reinforce the inventory of his business by buying phones and reselling them with the aim of generating additional profits.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loan.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a forty year old married woman with five children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been renting out gowns, traditional wear, and decorations for six years. She started with 3,000,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) and now has 9,000,000 UGX as her working capital. Her hardship is that some clients are negligent with the gowns and in the process they are destroyed. Her vision is being able to handle big events, plus educating her children. Lucy needs this loan to buy decorations and gowns for renting.

loan.use: to buy decorations and gowns for renting.

loan.name: Lavinah

texts.en:
Lavinah is a 25-year-old married woman with three children and she rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has a number of businesses, including retail, hardware, and drug shops. She has run these businesses for three years. Her hardship is bad debtors. Her vision is to have a well-established businesses and a well-educated, wealthy family.
Lavinah needs this loan to buy toothbrushes, bread, and clothes to sell.

loan.use: to buy toothbrushes, bread, and clothes to sell.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: buy clothing fabric

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy new products for general store

loan.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 46-year-old enterprising business lady. She is married to Stephen who is a policeman in Kenya. Beatrice has been a tailor for the past ten years with a monthly income of 12,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) which she uses to support her family.
She is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Beatrice will use the loan to buy materials thus offering a variety for her customers to choose from. With the anticipated profits from the business she will educate her children.
Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique which will help her improve the living standards of her family.

loan.use: To buy materials for her shop

loan.name: C5663 Twiyubake Group

texts.en:
Jeannette, 26 years old, is married. She is the leader of this group called "Twiyubake" in the local language. Jeannette has operated a business selling items like salt, sugar, water, cassava flour, cooking oil, and so on, for one year.
Jeannette has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand her business by buying more of the goods she sells. With the profits from this loan, Jeannette and her team would like to satisfy their families' basic needs, reinvest in their businesses, and start saving for their future.

loan.use: To purchase more goods like salt, sugar, water, cassava flour, cooking oil and so on.

loan.name: John

texts.en: John is a forty-nine-year-old married man with six children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop and coffee business for ten years and this has facilitated him in educating his children. His hardships are debtors and price fluctuations. He has a vision of a large scale retail shop, a poverty-free and well-educated family. John needs the loan to buy iron sheets for resale.

loan.use: to buy iron sheets for resale.

loan.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 44-year-old businessman and married. His wife is not working. They are blessed with two children. He has been selling electrical devices for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 5,500, which he uses to support his family.
He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Peter will use the loan to buy electrical machines to add to his shop. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hope and dream is to open a wholesale shop, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loan.use: To buy electrical machines to add to his shop.

loan.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with three school-going children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.
Mejumaa has operated a vegetable stall for the past four years. In addition, she sells charcoal. Her potential clients are her neighbors and friends. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, there is low demand for her business. She dreams of being a vegetables and charcoal supplier.
With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase cabbage, potatoes, spinach and a sack of charcoal. She decided to join Yehu because of the easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loan.use: To purchase cabbage, potatoes, spinach and a sack of charcoal.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to purchase food condiments

loan.name: Kiiko Development Bank Group

texts.en: Patience is a 24-year-old hardworking single mother of a child living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her dreams are taking care of her child and building her own house. She has been in the pub business for the last six months and she has been happy with the progress. Her challenge is customers failing to pay on time and her business goal is to own a hotel. Patience needs the loan to buy sodas and beers to sell.

loan.use: to buy sodas and beers to sell.

loan.name: C2199 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Victoire, a 29-year-old married mother of a one-year-old child, is the president of a group called "Tuzamurane". This is her fifth successful year in the business of selling soft drinks. She works every day from 7 am until 8 pm every day.
Victoire and her team have requested a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks (juice, water, beer and so on) to sell. By using this loan, Victoire and her team expect to earn more profits, which, in turn, will allow each member of the group to start saving as well as building a better future for their families.

loan.use: To purchase more soft drinks to sell.

loan.name: Hussnieh

texts.en:
Hussnieh is a 46-year-old married woman from A. Russeifeh, Jordan with five children.
Hussnieh is selling blankets from her home and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase more blankets to meet the increased demands for her products.
Hussnieh is looking to increase her living income so that she can finance the education of her children.

loan.use: To purchase more blankets to sell

loan.name: Reham

texts.en: Reham is a 27-year-old young woman. She is married with one son and one daughter. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Reham has a cosmetics store and she wants to purchase more cosmetics and accessories for sale, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $1,500 from FATEN. When Reham gets the loan, she will be able to purchase more accessories and cosmetics to her store and have more collections for sale. This will increase her income and enable her to offer better living conditions to her family. Reham is a conservative woman, so her husband Yasser is photographed instead in the store.

loan.use: To purchase more accessories and cosmetics to sell

loan.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday is a 35-year-old married man with three children. He lives in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to have a better residential house and to add to his income. He has been in the farming business for the last 12 years and has managed to buy more land for tea planting. He is faced with the challenge of the dry season where he harvests less. His dream is to farm on 100 acres of land. Sunday needs the loan to buy more acres of land for tea planting.

loan.use: to buy land to plant tea

loan.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 40 years old enterprising business lady who is married to Thomas. They both distribute timber and this has been their business for the past two years. They earn a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.
She is applying for her third loan term from KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Monica will use the loan to buy a power saw for cutting down more timber. With the anticipated profits from the business, she will buy another power saw.
Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses to improve the living standard of her family.

loan.use: To buy a power saw for cutting timber

loan.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 31-year-old married man and a father of two beautiful children. Samer has worked as a bus driver for five years. He is a man with a good reputation. That's why most of the parents request him to transport their children from/to school.
Samer is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner. This is his fourth loan with a perfect history of paying back his earlier loans. All previous loans reflected perfectly on both his social and financial situations. This loan will be used to do necessary maintenance to his bus, which is an important source of living for him.
Samer also has another business to run just like most of the Lebanese do these days to make their living. He transports water to most of the villages and villagers who suffer from water stinginess.
He hopes he can stay healthy and active to continue providing his family the best living he can afford.

loan.use: To do necessary maintenance to his bus

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase vegetables for her business.

loan.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 38-year-old mixed crop farmer who is married to Peter, a businessman. They are blessed with one child aged 3 years. She has been in the farming business for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.
She is applying for her first loan term with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Mary will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting in the next planting season on her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business she will buy a dairy cow.
Her hopes and dreams are to educate her child up to university level and venture into pig rearing which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loan.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm.

loan.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a thirty-four-year-old married man with four children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in mixed farming for ten years starting with one cow and a small plantation but now he has bought more land. His hardship is limited capital and his vision is a big commercial farm and educating his children. Francis needs the loan to buy banana shoots for planting.

loan.use: to buy banana stems for planting.

loan.name: Taha

texts.en:
Taha is a married man from Baq'a, Jordan and a father of three children.
Taha has a grocery store and is requesting a loan of 1700 JD to do decorations for his store and purchase more products.
Taha is looking to have one of his brothers to work with him in the store so that he can expand the daily working hours of the store.

loan.use: To decorate his store and purchase more products for it.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to purchase seasonings

loan.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a twenty-six-year-old married woman with three school-going children. Her husband Safari is a masonry who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She has a house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.
Rehema has operated a "queen cake" and porridge-selling business for the past two years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transporting her stock to her place of business. She dreams of establishing a cafe in the future.
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour and porridge flour for her business. She decided to join Yehu because it gives good repayment installment periods that are convenient for small-scale business operators.

loan.use: To purchase wheat flour and porridge flour for her business.

loan.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 30-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 1 to 10 years. She describes herself to be committed and humble. She operates a clothing sales business where she sells clothes to the local people. She has been involved in this business for 9 years. Her business is located near the country bus station in Nairobi. She describes her biggest business challenge to be weather challenges. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her clothes inventory. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a big hardware shop and also own a residential house.

loan.use: To add to her clothes inventory

loan.name: C5669 Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Celestin, 28 years old, is married and has two children who are 2 and 10 years old. He is the leader of this group called Abishyizehamwe in the local language. Celestin has operated a business selling salt, sugar, rice, and juice for two years.
Celestin has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand his business by buying more rice, sugar, Irish potatoes etc to sell. With profits from the loan, Celestin and his team would like to satisfy their families and reinvest in their businesses.

loan.use: To purchase more goods like rice, sugar, Irish potatoes

loan.name: Uzziah

texts.en: Uzziah is a thirty-seven-year-old married man with five children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the shoe business for ten years starting with 600,000 shillings and he now has 7,000,000 shillings as his working capital. His vision is to buy and sell wholesale plus educating his children. Uzziah needs the loan to buy shoes for resale.

loan.use: to buy shoes for resale.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy 9 boxes of plantains, 7 sacks of potatoes, and 3 sacks of oranges

loan.name: KangOmbe

texts.en:
Kangombe is a 48-year-old married mother of three children. She sells firewood in Kilifi, a business that has been in operation for the last five years and it has been a success.
Kangombe has been a KADET client and this marks her second time borrowing to finance her business. With this loan she plans to replenish her stock of firewood. The anticipated profits will be ploughed back into her business and into the repayment of the loan. Her dream is to be able to distribute firewood to the various schools in her locale.

loan.use: To replenish her stock of firewood.

loan.name: Motuya Plus Group

texts.en:
Motuya Plus is a group of 12 owners of small businesses chaired by Thrse. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC to grow their businesses.
Thrse is determined to be a successful businesswoman. She sells "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) and plastic items at the market located mid-east of Kinshasa. She became a micro-entrepreneur in 1974.
Thrse received already four loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and fully repaid them. She intends to use this loan to expand her inventory. She will buy more "pagnes" and resell them at a profit. Currently she earns a profit of US $30 a week. She will seek to make more profit by importing her products herself. Her dream is to become a "pagne" wholesaler.
Thrse is 56 years old, married, and the mother of four children aged between 18 and 31 years old. Two of them attend school.

loan.use: to increase the inventory of her business by buying more lengths of African print cloth.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loan.name: Ezira

texts.en: Ezira is a twenty-eight-year-old married man with one child and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the general store business for two years starting with 200,000 shillings and he now has 1,800,000 shillings in working capital. His hardships are limited funds, debtors and inflation but his vision is a bigger shop plus educating his child. Ezira needs the loan to buy sugar and rice for resale.

loan.use: to buy sugar and rice for resale.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy fish to cook and serve.

loan.name: Njogu

texts.en:
Njogu is a 40-year-old businessman and is married to Felista who is a housewife. They are blessed with three children. He has been a tailor for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 16,000 which he uses to support his family.
He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Njogu will use the loan to buy materials for making more clothes in his business. With the anticipated profit from the business he will buy another sewing machine.
His hopes and dreams are to distribute materials to his whole village and improve the living standard of his family.

loan.use: To buy materials for his business.

loan.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a thirty-three-year-old married woman with five school-going children. Her husband Shida Charo is a motorcycle transport operator who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She has a house with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.
Nelly has operated as a coconut vendor for the past four years; her potential clients are her neighbors and friends. She faces a major challenge of transporting her stock from the point of purchase to her place of sale. She dreams of establishing a coconut wholesale shop.
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loan.use: To purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy damask cloth

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase bundles of new clothes to sell and also hire new premises for her business.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy various articles

loan.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a thirty-three-year-old married man with three children and he rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in second-hand clothes for two years, starting with 1,200,000 shillings and now has 3,500,000 shillings as his working capital. His vision is a wholesale business plus a model family home. Godfrey needs the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loan.use: to buy used clothes to sell.

loan.name: Dora Anyango

texts.en:
Dora is a Kenyan married lady aged 34 with six children. She operates a clothing sales business. Her business is located near the country bus station. She has been in the business for ten years now. She says the business is profitable and the major challenge she has is that of inflation. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to ensure that the business is doing well.
Dora is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to increase the stock of clothes to meet the demand by her customers. She hopes to own a permanent stall where she will be running her business. She describes herself as aggressive, responsible and humble.

loan.use: To add to her stock of clothes for resale.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy groundnut paste

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy a cow to slaughter

loan.name: Enedi

texts.en: Enedi is a 30-year-old widow with four children renting a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling cassava flour for 15 years. She started with 500,000 shillings and now has 1,500,000 shillings as working capital. Her hardship is bad debts and her vision is having her own sheltered shop, buying a plot and building a house. Enedi needs the loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loan.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loan.name: Yosra

texts.en: Yosra is a Palestinian woman, married with one son and one daughter. Her husband and her son are employed with decent salaries. Yosra wants to make repairs to some parts of her house: the kitchen and the bathroom. These repairs include changing tiles, installing windows and doors, etc, but the amount of money Yosra has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Yosra gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to repair her house, improve her daily life and offer better living conditions to her family. Yosra is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in the FATEN branch.

loan.use: To pay for repairing some parts of the house.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase stocks of fresh fish and cooking oil, and to buy materials to build a place for her business.

loan.name: Mabondeli Plus Group

texts.en:
Peter is the leader of the Community Bank Mabondeli Plus, which is composed of 11 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.
Peter runs a telephone booth that sells prepaid cards, and he is a money changer in his area located east of Kinshasa. He began his business in 1993. With hard work and determination, his business has prospered. Peter is now well known and liked in this area. He has already received six MFI HOPE DRC loans and fully repaid them. Since that time his business has prospered, and the loans he has received have helped him rent a well-located business place. He makes $20 of profit each day. Peter intends with the next loan to diversify his business by adding a game business for children and generate additional profits. His dream is to have a transport company in his area. He is 28 years old and single.

loan.use: to diversify his business by adding a game business for children to generate additional profits.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loan.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 33-year-old married woman with six school-going children. Her husband Charles is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.
Beatrice has operated as a fried fish vendor for the past ten years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of supplying fish to other retail operators.
With this loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase fresh fish and a new cooking machine for her business. She decided to join Yehu because it understands its clients needs.

loan.use: To purchase fresh fish and a new cooking machine for her business.

loan.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hardworking business woman, age 29. She is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. She has been selling cereals for the last five years to make a living. She also does farming for more income. Mary has employed one person to assist her to manage the business.
In the next 5 years, Mary wants to buy a lorry for transporting cereals. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy beans, maize, and peas for resale.

loan.use: To buy maize, beans, and peas.

loan.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 47-year-old married woman with five school-going children. Her husband Jilani Tinga is a teacher who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.
Josephine has operated as a water and fish vendor for the past twelve years. In addition, she owns a small retail shop. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.
With this loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase more stocks of fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loan.use: To purchase more stock of fish for resale.

loan.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 44-year-old woman, who is married and has four sons and three daughters. Her husband is a worker with a decent salary. Hanan has her own project which is raising sheep and benefits from its products for sale. She wants to expand her project by purchasing more sheep to increase her sales and so increase her income, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN.
When Hanan gets the loan, she will be able to purchase more sheep and this will enable her to expand her project and increase her sales and income. This will provide her and her family better living conditions. Hanan is photographed in the FATEN branch.

loan.use: To purchase more sheep.

loan.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is married and blessed with four children. For the last eighteen years, she has been selling dried and fried fish to make a living. She has employed one person to help her to manage the business. She has been able to boost her business with her previous loans from Faulu Kenya. In the next five years, she wants to become more financially stable. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy more fish for resale.

loan.use: To buy more fish.

loan.name: Trkan

texts.en:
Trkan is married. She has two children, 28 and 25 years old, who are both working. She opened her shop 10 years ago.
Trkan started by selling products made from roses (rose-scented prayer rugs, prayer beads, and air freshener) later she added jewelry. People from her hometown started to bring her their local honey and jams which they were selling at very reasonable prices. She used the profits from her sales to expand her inventory.
With this loan, she wants to enlarge the variety of her merchandise by adding mens shirts and pants made from locally produced fabric and also belts. She believes that she can expand her customer base and her sales with new merchandise.
In the future, Trkan would like to keep expanding her shops profit and help others to work. She wants to encourage people to use natural products. Her one wish is for a peaceful and comfortable life. She is an active and hard-working woman.
Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff
Trkan evli. alan ,28 ve 25 yanda iki tane ocuu var. Trkan Hanm 10 yl once dkkan am ve gl rnleri(gl kokulu seccade,tesbih,gl oda spreyi v.s.) satmaya balam. Daha sonra dkkanna tak rnlerine de yer vermi. Memleketinden yresel bal ve reeller getirmeye balam. rnlerini ok uygun fiyatlara satyor. rnlerden kazandka eitlerini oaltm. Bu kredi ile, yerli kumatan erkek gmlek ve pantolon almak istiyor. Yeni rnler alarak ,mterilerinin oalacana inanyor. leride,irket olmak,kazanmak ve kazandrmak istiyor. nsanlar doal rnler kullanmaya tevik etmek istiyor. Rahat ve huzurlu bir hayat tek dilei. Heyecanl,aktif ve alkan bir kadn.

loan.use: to buy more inventory, e.g., men's shirts and pants.

loan.name: C5683 Terimbere Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 23 years old and single. Emmanuel is also the leader of this group, which is called "Terimbere" in the local language. Emmanuel employs two people to help him and he has two years of experience. He works from 7:00 a.m until 6:00 p.m every day. He is the first person on the left in the picture.
Emmanuel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by buying more paper, books,calculators and staplers to sell. With this profit, Emmanuel hope to satisfy their customers and save for their futures.

loan.use: To purchase more paper, books, calculators, etc

loan.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 24 years old and married to Philip who does "bodaboda" (motorcycle transport) business to produce additional income for the family. She has two children ages three and two years old.
She runs a retail shop and she has been in business for two years. Right now her monthly income from the business is 3,000. She is taking out a loan of KES 5,000 to add more stock of tea leaves, salt, and detergents for sale.
Margaret plans to expand her business with the anticipated profit from the business.This is her first loan and her hope and dream is to continue with her retail shop and to educate her children.

loan.use: To buy more stock of tea leaves, salt, and washing detergent for sale.

loan.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a forty-two-year-old married woman with four children who go to school. Her husband Boniface is a driver who contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. She has a house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.
Jane has operated a green grocery for the past three years. Her potential clients are her neighbors, friends and hawkers (peddlers). She faces a major challenge of transporting her stock from the market to her place of business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop.
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase vegetables and fruits for her business. She decided to join Yehu because it serves rural area clients.

loan.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits for her business.

loan.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a 52-year-old married woman with three school-going children. Her husband Justine Ali Sirya is employed and also contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.
Saumu has operated a fish butchery for the past twelve years; her potential clients are passers by and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of theft. She dreams of establishing a bigger butchery in the future.
With this loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase stocks of fish and rent a new business premises. She decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loan.use: To purchase stocks of fish and rent new business premises.

loan.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 33-year-old married woman with four school-going children. Her husband Sylvester is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.
Emily has operated a retail shop for the past twelve years; in addition she also sells piped water. Her potential clients are her neighbors and passers by. She faces a major challenge of transporting her goods from the market place of business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop.
With this loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar for resale. She decided to join Yehu because it provides easy access loan facilities.

loan.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar for resale.

loan.name: Dopoi

texts.en:
Dopoi is 30 years old. He is married and blessed with two children. He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last seven years. His farm is in a productive area that has proved to be good for maize farming.
He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staffs in his area of residence. He has been a good client with KADET and this will be his first loan, with which he is planning to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profits from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production and educate his children.
His dream is to become a large-scale farmer, and buy a bigger piece of land and build a permanent home. He is an industrious man who can do more if supported financially.

loan.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers.

loan.name: Clara Agripina

texts.es:
Clara Agripina tiene 39 aos de edad es soltera tiene cinco hijos vive con los hijos de veintids, veintiuno, trece, once y tres meses de edad en el Cantn Ventanas Provincia de los Ros.
Es integrante de la VRC Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan del Pueblo viejo Perteneciente a Ventanas se dedican a labores agrcolas a la siembra de cacao.
Clara se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao las compras y ventas las realiza en san Juan. Solicita el crdito para poder dar mantenimiento a los cultivos de cacao para que el producto salga de mejor calidad.
El crdito le ser de mucha ayuda para poder mejorar los cultivos y obtener utilidades al momento de vender los productos.
Los desafos que se le presenta muy frecuente es la competencia y las plagas. El sueo es poder estar siempre con la familia y poder comprarse una casa.
En los tiempos libres le gusta pasear con la familia.
texts.en:
Clara Agripina is 39 years old. She is single and she has five children. She lives with her children, aged twenty-two, twenty-one, thirteen, eleven, and three months old. They live in the canton of Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios.
She is a member of the communal bank "Cevallos", which is located in the San Francisco enclosure. It belongs to the Parrish of San Juan del Pueblo Viejo, in Ventanas. The population in Ventanas is dedicated to agriculture and cocoa cultivations.
Clara is an agriculturist who cultivates cocoa. The makes her purchases and carries out her sales in San Juan. She requests a loan to carry out maintenance care on her cocoa plantation so that her product will be of higher quality.
The loan will be of great help to improve her cultivation and to obtain better profits at the moment of sale.
The challenges which she faces very frequently are the competition and plagues. Her dream is to always be with her family and to buy a house.
In her spare time she enjoys travel with her family.

loan.use: to carry out maintenance care to her cocoa plantation

loan.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 21-year-old single borrower. He describes himself as quiet, submissive, and innovative. He operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, rice, flour, tea leaves, detergents, beverages, and other items. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a shopping centre.
He describes his biggest business challenge to be customers who buy goods on credit, and then fail to pay as per agreement. He will use the KES 10,000 loan to add to his stock of sugar, rice, flour, detergents, beverages, and other items.
His business goal is to grow his business into a wholesale business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will marry a woman and have children of his own.

loan.use: to add to his stock of sugar, rice, flour, detergents, and beverages.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to expand his quarry business.

loan.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is a poultry farmer living in Masindi, Uganda. She is a widow with three children and the responsibility for looking after the family rests solely on her.
Doreen has been in poultry business for six years. She started with local chickens; then bought 30 broilers and now has over 100 birds. She wants a loan to buy feed for her poultry.
Doreen dreams of building a house and enlarging her business.

loan.use: to buy feed for her poultry.

loan.name: C9291 Icyizere Fad Group

texts.en:
Sabin is 35 years old and married with six children between the ages of 2 and 23 years old. He is the president of a group that is called "Icyizere fad" in the local language. The group is composed of three people: two men and one woman. Sabin is the first person on the left side and he sells stationery. This business is well organized. He employs two people to help him. He works from 7am until 8pm every day and he has eight years of experience.
Sabin and his team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more staplers, books, paper punches, and calculators in larger quantities. With the resulting profit, Sabin and his team will be able to save in the future and pay their children's school fees.

loan.use: to purchase more staplers, books, paper punches, and calculators.

loan.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a thirty-eight-year-old widowed woman with two school-going children. She has a house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.
Catherine has operated a boutique for the past three years. Her potential clients are her neighbors, relatives and friends. She faces the major challenge of seasonality where demand is high at month end only. She dreams of owning a beauty shop.
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of new clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu because they cater to their clients' needs.

loan.use: To purchase bundles of new clothes for resale.

loan.name: Fleming

texts.en:
Fleming is 48 years old. He is married and together they have five children. He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last twelve years. His farm is in a productive area which has proven to be good for maize farming.
He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan, with which he is planning to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming, to increase his maize production and to educate his children.
His dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land and build a permanent home.

loan.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers.

loan.name: Jesus Deliva

texts.es:
Jess Deliva es soltera tiene cincuentaisiete aos de edad tiene una hija, vive con la hija de treintainueve aos de edad en el Cantn Ventanas Provincia de los Ros.
Es integrante de la VRC Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan del Pueblo viejo Perteneciente a Ventanas se dedican a labores agrcolas a la siembra de cacao.
Jess se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao las compras y ventas las realiza en san Juan. Solicita el crdito para poder dar mantenimiento a l cacao y obtener una buena cosecha.
El crdito ser de mucha ayuda para poder mejorar el cultivo de cacao para venderlo a un buen precio.
Los desafos que se le presenta muy frecuente es la competencia y la plaga. El sueo es compartir momentos agradables y estar siempre con la familia y salir a delante.
En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear con la hija por el pueblo.
texts.en:
Jesus Deliva is single and she is fifty-seven years old. She has a daughter. She lives with her daughter who is thirty-nine years old and they live in the canton of Los Rios.
She is a member of the communal bank "Cevallos", which is located in the San Francisco enclosure. It belongs to the Parrish of San Juan del Pueblo Viejo, in Ventanas. The population in Ventanas is dedicated to agriculture and cocoa cultivations.
Jesus is an agriculturist who cultivates cocoa. The makes her purchases and carries out her sales in San Juan. She requests a loan to carry out maintenance care on her cocoa plantation so that her product will be of higher quality.
The loan will be a great help to improve her cocoa cultivation and she will be able to sell it at a good price.
The challenges which she faces very frequently are the competition and plagues. Her dream is to share happy moments, to always remain with her family, and to move forward.
In her spare time she enjoys visiting the village with her daughter.

loan.use: to carry out maintenace care to her cocoa plantation to ensure a good harvest.

loan.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache is a married woman with four school-going children. Her husband Rajab, who is employed, contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.
Kache has operated a cafe for the past year; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces the major challenge of theft. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for her cafe. She decided to join Yehu because it gives people funds to expand their businesses.

loan.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for her cafe.

loan.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 52-year-old married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself as honest and humble. She operates a crude oil sales business where she sells used oil. She has been involved in this business for 15 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located near the city stadium in Nairobi. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to add more oil to meet the demand of her customers. Her business goal is to open the same kind of business in another area within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will give her children a good education to the university level.

loan.use: To buy crude oil.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase a new motorbike.

loan.name: Sandra Madelaine

texts.es:
Sandra Madelaine es soltera tiene 19 aos de edad no tiene hijos vive con la mam y las tres hermanas en el Cantn Ventanas Provincia de los ros.
Es integrante de la VRC Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan del Pueblo viejo Perteneciente a Ventanas se dedican a labores agrcolas a la siembra de cacao.
Sandra se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao las compras y ventas las realizan en San Juan .
Solicita el crdito para poder dar mantenimiento al cultivo de cacao para poder aspirar a venderlo a un precio ms conveniente.
El Crdito ser de mucha ayuda para suplir necesidades econmicas y mantener en buenas condiciones el cacao.
Los desafos que enfrenta a diario es la competencia, las plagas y las enfermedades que puedan dar al cultivo.
El sueo de Sandra es poder salir adelante con la familia. En los tiempos libres le gusta ver televisin.
texts.en:
Sandra Madelaine, 19, is single and has no children. She lives with her mother and three sisters in Ventanas Canton, Los Ros Province. Shes a member of the Cevallos communal bank thats located in Recinto San Francisco belonging to San Juan del Pueblo Parish that belongs to Ventanas. They are cocoa bean farmers.
Sandra is a cocoa bean farmer and makes her purchases and her sales in San Juan. She requests the loan to provide maintenance for her cocoa bean crops to be able to sell it at a better price. The loan will be of much help for her to meet her economic needs and to maintain her cocoa beans in good condition. The challenges she faces are pests and illnesses that can affect her crops.
Sandras dream is to be able to get ahead with her family. In her free time she enjoys watching television.

loan.use: to provide maintenance for her cocoa bean crops.

loan.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 32 years old and married to her husband Joseph, who is a public service vehicle driver. She has a business selling construction stones from a quarry on her land for the past three years with the monthly income of 6,000 Kenya shillings (KES), which she uses to support her family.
She is applying for her third loan with KADET after successfully repaying her previous loans. Mary will use the loan to buy another quarry ground, which will increase her income. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children.
Mary's dreams are to buy a trailer to help her transport the stones, which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loan.use: To buy another quarry ground, which will increase her income.

loan.name: John

texts.en:
John is 49 years old, married, and blessed with eight children. His wife Mary is a small-scale farmer and she adds some income to the family. John operates a small hotel in Muhoroni town and has been in operation for a period of four years, earning a monthly income of 45,000 Kenya shillings (KES).
John has requested a loan of 70,000 KES from KADET LTD, which is his second loan term after repaying the previous one successfully. He hopes to use this amount to purchase a refrigerator and 50 plastic chairs for his hotel.
The anticipated amounts will be used to pay school fees and put up more rental houses. His dream is to prosper in business and establish a sugarcane farm.

loan.use: To buy a refrigerator and 50 plastic chairs for his hotel.

loan.name: Lucila Cruz

texts.es:
Lucila Cruz tiene 30 aos de edad es soltera tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos de once y nueve aos de edad en el Cantn ventanas Provincia de los Ros.
Es integrante de la VRC Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan del Pueblo viejo Perteneciente a Ventanas se dedican a labores agrcolas a la siembra de cacao.
Lucila se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao las compras y las ventas de los productos los realiza en san Juan, Solicita el crdito para poder dar mantenimiento a los cultivos de cacao.
El crdito ser de mucha ayuda para poder cambiar el estado econmico de la familia y mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El sueo de Lucila es poder ayudar a los hijos para que puedan culminar los estudios y ser profesionales. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir de paseo y practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Lucila Cruz, 30, is single and has two children. She lives with her children who are 11 and 9 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ros Province. Shes a member of the Cevallos communal bank thats located in Recinto San Francisco belonging to San Juan del Pueblo Viejo Parish that belongs to Ventanas. They are cocoa bean farmers.
Lucila is a cocoa bean farmer and makes her purchases and her sales in San Juan. She requests the loan to provide maintenance for her cocoa bean crops to be able to sell it at a better price. The loan will be of much help for her to change her familys economic state and to keep the crops in good condition.
Lucilas dream is to be able to help her children finish their schooling and become professionals. In her free time she likes going out on excursions and to play sports.

loan.use: to provide maintenance for her cocoa bean crops.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To add stock of clothes

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm

loan.name: Francis Ndirangu

texts.en: Francis is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be humble and committed to his work. He operates a restaurant business where he sells food to the local people. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy and densely populated area in Nairobi. He describes his biggest business challenges to be the residents and business people in the area. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to add stock of food items. His business goal is to open a big hotel within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children to the university level.

loan.use: To buy food items

loan.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 47 years old, married, and they have five children. He has been a farmer for the last fifteen years. He learned about KADET through an advertisement done by KADET. He paid his previous loan well and this marks his second loan from KADET LTD, with which he plans to buy farm supplies. He plans to use the proceeds from the loan to plow back into the farm. He is an honest man who will work hard to achieve if supported financially.

loan.use: to buy farm supplies.

loan.name: Betza Elizabeth

texts.es:
Betza Elizabeth es soltera tiene treintainueve aos de edad tiene tres hijos, vive con los hijos de veintids, veinte, dieciocho aos de edad en el cantn Ventanas provincia de los Ros.
Es integrante de la VRC Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan del Pueblo viejo Perteneciente a Ventanas se dedican a labores agrcolas a la siembra de cacao.
Betza se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en San Juan.
Solicita el crdito para poder dar mantenimiento a los cultivos de cacao para obtener un producto de buena calidad y poder tener mejores utilidades.
El crdito ser de mucha ayuda para poder invertir en los cultivos de cacao y mejorar los ingresos de la familia. Los desafos que se le presentan muy frecuentes son la competencia y las plagas en los cultivos. En los Tiempos libres de gusta salir de paseo y ver televisin.
texts.en:
Betza Elizabeth, 39, is single and has three children. She lives with her children who are 22, 20 and 18 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ros Province.
Shes a member of the Cevallos communal bank thats located in Recinto San Francisco belonging to San Juan del Pueblo Viejo Parish that belongs to Ventanas. They are cocoa bean farmers.
Betza is a cocoa bean farmer and makes her purchases and her sales in San Juan. She requests the loan to provide maintenance for her cocoa bean crops to obtain better quality products and higher income.
The loan will be very useful to be able to invest in her cocoa bean crops and improve the familys income. She faces frequent challenges which are competition and crop pests.
In her free time she enjoys going out on excursions and watching television.

loan.use: to provide maintenance for her cocoa bean crops.

loan.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 36 years old, a business lady, and she is married to Simon who is a village chief. They are blessed with three children. She has been distributing beverages to other retailers for the past three years with the monthly income of about KES 10,500 which she uses to support her family.
She is applying for her third loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Lucy will use the loan to buy a fridge for storing soft drinks and to add more soft drinks. With the anticipated profit from the business she will expand her business.
She hopes to open a wholesale shop and be the main distributor around her village.

loan.use: To buy a fridge for storing soft drinks and to add more soft drinks.

loan.name: Nkioriais

texts.en:
Nkioriais is 41 years old, married, and together they have three children. He has been a farmer for the past six years. He has been a good client. He paid his previous loan well, and this is his third loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy farm supplies.
With the profits generated he plans to pay school fees for his children. He dreams of being a prominent farmer. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more despite limited resources.

loan.use: to buy farm supplies.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy music systems to sell.

loan.name: Monica Isabel

texts.es:
Mnica Isabel tiene 32 aos vive en unin libre tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo de ocho aos de edad en el Cantn ventanas provincia de los ros.
Es integrante de la VRC Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan del Pueblo viejo Perteneciente a Ventanas se dedican a labores agrcolas a la siembra de cacao.
Mnica se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao las compras y las ventas de los productos para los cultivos los compra en San Juan. Solicita el crdito para poder dar mantenimiento a los cultivos de cacao.
El crdito ser de mucha ayuda para poder invertir en los cultivos de cacao. A los desafos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia y las plagas.
En el tiempo libre le gusta andar en bicicleta.
texts.en:
Mnica Isabel, 32, lives in a common law relationship and has a son. She lives with her husband and 8-year-old son in Ventanas Canton, Los Ros Province. Shes a member of the Cevallos communal bank thats located in Recinto San Francisco that belongs to San Juan del Pueblo Viejo Parish in Ventanas. They are cocoa bean farmers.
Mnica is a cocoa bean farmer. Her purchases and sales take place in San Juan. Shes asking for a loan to provide crop maintenance to her cocoa beans. The loan will be of much use to her to be able to invest in her cocoa bean crops. The challenges she faces are competition and pests. She enjoys bicycle riding in her free time.

loan.use: to provide maintenance for her cocoa bean crops.

loan.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a thirty-seven-year-old married woman with three school-going children. Her husband, Kahindi, is a mechanic who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.
Mariam has operated a retail shop for the past fourteen years. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces the major challenge of competition from other retail operators. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop.
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility to loan facilities.

loan.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for her business.

loan.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is a 51-year-old enterprising businessman who is married to Martha. They are blessed with four children ages 12, 8, 6, and 4 years. He has been in the welding business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family members.
He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced to it by an existing KADET customer. Mathew will use the loan to buy welding metals and welding equipment to increase his income. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children.
His dream is to educate his children up to university level and improve the living standard of his family.

loan.use: To buy welding metals to increase his income

loan.name: Samuel Thiongo

texts.en: Samuel is a 30-year-old married man. He has two children with ages ranging from 3 years to 8 years. He describes himself to be devoted and passionate. Samuel operates a shoe sales business where he sells shoes to the local people. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a growing shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenge to be harrassment by the local administration. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to increase his stock of shoes. His business goal is to grow his business into wholesale within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will own very big shoe sales shops in Thika.

loan.use: To increase stock of shoes

loan.name: Rosa Juana

texts.es:
Rosa Juana tiene treintainueve aos de edad vive en unin libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el Cantn Ventanas provincia de los Ros.
Es integrante de la VRC Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan del Pueblo viejo Perteneciente a Ventanas se dedican a labores agrcolas a la siembra de cacao.
Rosa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao las compras y las ventas de los productos para los cultivos compra en San Juan. Solicita el crdito para poder dar mantenimiento a los cultivos de cacao.
El crdito ser de mucha ayuda para poder invertir en los cultivos de cacao. Los desafos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia, plagas y enfermedades.
En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte en especial el boly.
texts.en:
Rosa Juana, 39, lives in a common law relationship and has two children. She lives with her husband and children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ros Province. Shes a member of the Cevallos communal bank thats located in Recinto San Francisco that belongs to San Juan del Pueblo Viejo Parish in Ventanas. They are cocoa bean farmers.
Rosa Juana is a cocoa bean farmer. Her purchases and sales take place in San Juan. Shes asking for a loan to provide crop maintenance to her cocoa beans. The loan will be of much use to her to be able to invest in her cocoa bean crops. The challenges she faces are competition, pests and crop diseases. In her free time she enjoys playing sports, especially volleyball.

loan.use: to provide maintenance for her cocoa bean crops.

loan.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is a 36-year-old businessman who is married to Ann, who is a farmer. They are blessed with one child aged 3 years. He has been selling timber as a primary business and farming as a secondary business for the past 6 years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.
He is applying for his second loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Eliud will use the loan to buy a power saw and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profits from the two businesses, he will educate his child and save for the future.
He hopes to buy a piece of land and venture into tea farming, which will help him improve the living standards of the family.

loan.use: To buy a power saw and fertilizer for his farm

loan.name: Camlus

texts.en: Camlus used his previous loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy more fabric for making clothes. He hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future. He needs another loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric.

loan.use: To buy fabric

loan.name: C2362 Abizeranye Group

texts.en:
Faina, 49 years old, is married and has seven children between the ages of 5 and 22 years old. She has owned a sewing business for about thirty years. Her business is open from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day. Faina is the leader of this group, which is called "Abizeranye" in the local language. In the photo, she is the first person on the left.
Faina has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more clothes for sewing. Faina and her team will reinvest their profits into their businesses and save for their children's school fees.

loan.use: To purchase more clothes for sewing.

loan.name: Dorothy Apiyo

texts.en:
Dorothy is a 25-year-old married woman. She has 2 children, 2 and 6 years old. Dorothy describes herself as humble and God-fearing.

Dorothy has operated a clothing sales business for 3 years, selling to the local people. Her business is located in a densely populated area in Kisumu. Dorothy describes her biggest business challenge as insecurity. She will use this KES 20,000 loan to increase her stock of clothes. Her business goal is to grow her business into wholesale within 5 years. Dorothy hopes that, in the future, she will open another clothing sales business.

loan.use: To increase her stock of secondhand clothes

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy phone accessories and farm supplies for resale

loan.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
Mara de la Cruz tiene cuarenta y un aos de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en el Cantn ventanas provincia de los Ros.
Es integrante de la VRC Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan del Pueblo viejo Perteneciente a Ventanas se dedican a labores agrcolas a la siembra de cacao.
Mara se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, las compras y las ventas lo hace en San Juan. Solicita el crdito para poder sembrar ms hectareas de cacao compar insumos, fertilizantes, y abonos para dar un buen cuidado a los cultivos para mantenerlos en buen estado y luego venderlos.
El crdito ser de mucha ayuda para poder invertir en el mejoramiento de los cultivos de cacao. Los desafos a los que se enfrenta son la competencia, plagas y enfermedades.
En el tiempo libre le gusta salir de paseo por el campo con los padres.
texts.en:
Mara de la Cruz is 41 years old. She is single and doesn't have any children. She lives with her parents in Ventanas canton, in Los Ros province.
Mara is a member of the Cevallos community bank which is located in San Francisco, in San Juan del Pueblo Viejo parish, in Ventanas. The members of this bank work in agriculture, growing cacao.
Mara is a farmer who grows cacao. She makes her purchases and her sales in San Juan. She is requesting this loan so that she can cultivate more cacao by purchasing materials and fertilizers to maintain her cacao crops and then sell them.
This loan will help Mara to invest in improving her cacao crops. The challenges that she faces are competition, pests and diseases.
In her free time, Mara enjoys going out for walks in the country with her parents.

loan.use: to purchase materials such as fertilizer to care for her crops

loan.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a 36-year-old married woman with four school-going children. Her husband, Jonathan Baya, is a carpenter who contributes in providing for the family's basic needs. Constance has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.
Constance has operated a business selling potatoes for the past five years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of owning a caf in the future. Constance plans on using the KES 20,000 loan to purchase sacks of potatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loan.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes for resale.

loan.name: Diana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Diana Elizabeth tiene veintin aos de edad es soltera tiene tres hijos, vive con los hijos en el Cantn Ventanas provincia de los Ros.
Es integrante de la VRC Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan del Pueblo viejo Perteneciente a Ventanas se dedican a labores agrcolas a la siembra de cacao.
Diana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, las compras y las ventas lo hace en San Juan. Solicita el crdito para poder comprar plantas de cacao, abonos, fertilizantes, urea, lquidos, veneno para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos para venderlos a un buen precio.
El crdito ser de mucha ayuda para poder invertir en el mejoramiento de los cultivos. Los desafos a los que se enfrenta son la competencia, plagas y enfermedades.
En el tiempo libre le gusta escuchar msica en especial los vallenatos.
texts.en:
Diana Elizabeth is 21 years old. She is single and has three children. She lives with her children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ros province.
Diana is a member of the Cevallos community bank which is located in San Francisco, in San Juan del Pueblo Viejo parish, in Ventanas. The members of this bank work in agriculture, growing cacao.
Diana is a farmer who grows cacao. She makes her purchases and her sales in San Juan. She is requesting this loan so that she can purchase cacao plants, fertilizers, urea, liquids, and insecticides to maintain her cacao crops and sell them at a good price.
This loan will help Diana to invest in improving her crops. The challenges that she faces are competition, pests and diseases.
In her free time, Diana enjoys listening to music, especially Los Vallenatos.

loan.use: to purchase cacao plants, fertilizers, urea, liquids, and insecticides to maintain her crops

loan.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward, 28 years old, is a hardworking man living in Hoima, Uganda, in a rented house. He has operated a produce business for 2 years. He started with capital of 300,000 UGX but now has 3,000,000 UGX as his working capital. Edward needs a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loan.use: to buy maize and beans

loan.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is married and blessed with three children. For the last twenty years, she has been managing a grocery to make a living. She has employed one person to help her to run the business. Hellen has retained her business because of her good reputation with her customers. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. With 50,000 Kenya shillings, she wants to buy fruits for resale.

loan.use: To buy fruits.

loan.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a lady aged 49 years old, single, and blessed with four children, aged 18, 8, 6 and 4. She owns a tailoring shop in Kapsabet town and has been in the business for a period of 19 years, earning a monthly income of about KES 20,000.
She has borrowed a loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD, this being her seventh loan term after she successfully repaid the previous one successfully. She wishes to use the money to purchase sewing threads and materials for the business. The anticipated profits will be used to educate her children and to plow back into the business. She hopes to prosper in business and improve the living standards of her family.

loan.use: To purchase sewing threads and materials.

loan.name: Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal HATUN RUMIYOC; El banco est ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Elena; ella tiene 52 aos de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de bar, ella vende cervezas y gaseosas, ella trabaja desde las 4:00 p.m hasta las 1:00 a.m y por medio de esta trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de bar. La socia solicita el prstamo para comprar gaseosas y cervezas al por mayor.
La socia est feliz por el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the 'Hatun Rumiyoc' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.
Elena is 52 years old, married, and has four children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her bar where she sells beer and soda. She works from 4.00pm to 1.00am and, through this work, she supports her children. Elena would like to expand and improve her bar business. She is requesting this loan to buy beer and soda wholesale.
Elena is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loan.use: to invest in buying beer and soda wholesale

loan.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis Alfredo tiene 24 aos de edad vive en unin libre tiene una hija, vive con la esposa y con la hija de dos aos de edad en el Cantn Ventanas provincia de los Ros.
Es integrante de la VRC Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan del Pueblo viejo Perteneciente a Ventanas se dedican a labores agrcolas a la siembra de cacao.
Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao las compras y ventas las realizan en San Juan. Solicita el crdito para poder dar mantenimiento al cultivo de cacao para poder aspirar a venderlo a un precio ms conveniente.
El Crdito ser de mucha ayuda para suplir necesidades econmicas y mantener en buenas condiciones el cacao. Los desafos a los que se enfrenta a diario son la competencia, las plagas y las enfermedades que puedan daar al cultivo.
El sueo de Luis es poder comprarse una casa para poder vivir con la familia, en los tiempos libres le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Luis Alfredo is 24, lives in a common-law relationship and has a daughter. He lives with his wife and his two year-old daughter in Ventanas Canton, Los Ros Province. Hes a member of the Cevallos communal bank thats located in Recinto San Francisco that is part of San Juan del Pueblo Viejo Parish in Ventanas. They grow cacao.
Luis grows cacao, and carries out his sales and purchases in San Juan. He is applying for the loan to maintain his cacao crop, so that he can hope to sell it at a better price.
The loan will be a big help to him in meeting his financial needs, and maintaining his cacao crop in good condition. The challenges he faces daily are competition, pests and crop diseases. Luis' dream is to be able to buy a house for himself and his family. In his free time he likes to play sports.

loan.use: To maintain his cacao crop.

loan.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a fifty-year-old married woman with five children who are all grown up. Her husband, Lucas Kalama, is a male nurse who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and transportation.
Mary has operated a firewood selling business for the past fifteen years. In addition, she also owns a small retail shop. Her potential clients are the neighbors. She faces a major challenge in the transporting of her goods. She dreams of expanding her business.
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu because they give loans to small scale business operators.

loan.use: To purchase bundles of firewood for resale.

loan.name: Nestor Ivan

texts.es:
Nestor Ivan tiene 19 aos de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en el Cantn Ventanas provincia de los Ros.
Es integrante de la VRC Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan del Pueblo viejo Perteneciente a Ventanas se dedican a labores agrcolas a la siembra de cacao.
Nestor se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao las compras y ventas las realiza en san Juan.
Solicita el crdito para poder dar mantenimiento a los cultivos de cacao para que el producto salga de mejor calidad.
El crdito le ser de mucha ayuda para poder mejorar los cultivos y obtener utilidades al momento de vender los productos.
Los desafos que se le presenta muy frecuente es la competencia y la plaga. El sueo es poder estar siempre junto con la familia y por ello salir a delante.
En los tiempos libres le gusta pasear por el campo con los padres.
texts.en:
Nestor Ivn is 19, single, and has no children. He lives with his parents in Ventanas canton in Los Ros province.
Hes a member of the Cevallos communal bank thats located in Recinto San Francisco that is part of San Juan del Pueblo Viejo parish in Ventanas. They make their living growing cacao. Nestor grows cacao, and does his buying and selling in San Juan.
He is applying for the loan to maintain his cacao crop, so that the product will be of better quality. The loan will be a big help to him in improving his crops, and in making a profit at the time he sells his products. The challenges that often arise are competition, and pests.
His dream is to be with the family always, and in this way get ahead in life. In his free time, he likes to go for walks in the countryside with his parents.

loan.use: To maintain his cacao crop.

loan.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is a thirty-six-year-old diploma holder, married with three children, living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family is vested in her, and her family dream is to educate her children and build a permanent house.
She has a retail shop which she has been operating for the last three years. She faces the challenge of price fluctuation, and her dream is to own a wholesale shop. Jeniffer needs the loan to buy soap, sugar and matchboxes for resale.

loan.use: to buy merchandise for resale.

loan.name: Wilson Agustin

texts.es:
Wilson Agustin tuene 44 aos vive en unin libre no tiene hijos, vive con la esposa en el cantn ventanas provincia de los Ros.
Es integrante de la VRC Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan del Pueblo viejo Perteneciente a Ventanas se dedican a labores agrcolas a la siembra de cacao.
Wilson se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao las compras y ventas las realiza en san Juan. Solicita el crdito para poder dar mantenimiento a los cultivos de cacao para que el producto salga de mejor calidad. El crdito le ser de mucha ayuda para poder mejorar los cultivos y obtener mejores utilidades para el bienestar de la familia. Los desafos que se le presenta muy frecuente son la competencia y las plagas. El sueo es poder estar siempre junto con la familia y por ello salir a delante. En los tiempos libres le gusta pasear por el campo con la esposa y visitar a los familiares.
texts.en:
Wilson Agustin is 44, is in a common-law relationship, and doesn't have children. He lives with his wife in Ventanas canton, in Los Ros province.
He is a member of the "Cevallos" communal bank, located in Recinto San Farancisco, which is part of San Juan del Pueblo Viejo parish in Ventanas. They make their living growing cacao. Wilson grows cacao, and does his buying and selling in San Juan.
He is applying for the loan to maintain his cacao crop, and produce a better quality product. The loan will be a big help to him in improving his crop, and getting better earnings for his family's well-being. The challenges he faces are competition and pests.
His dream is to be together with his family always, and in this way get ahead in life. In his free time, he likes to go for walks in the countryside, and visit family members.

loan.use: To maintain his cacao crop.

loan.name: Anacleta

texts.es: La socia pertenece al banco comunal IMASUMAC II; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac en la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco. La socia es la Sra. Anacleta; La socia tiene 52 aos D. edad, la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales dos D. ellos son independientes y los otros dos tiene 29, 9 aos D. edad; la socia tiene un automvil el cual lo hace trabajar con un chofer y le paga el 30 por ciento D. lo que ingresa diario; La socia desea invertir el crdito en la reparacin D. su automvil porque el chofer ha chocado y ahora esta en el taller y requiere planchado y pintado, la socia requiere el dinero para poder sacar su automvil del taller y continuar con el trabajo. La socia solicita el prstamo para invertir en el pago D. la refaccin y reparacin D. su automvil, planchado y pintado. La socia agradece el prstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas D. acuerdo al cronograma D. pagos.
texts.en:
She belongs to the communal bank IMASUMAC II. The communal bank is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province of Cusco, and the department of Cusco.
Her name is Anacleta. She is 52 years old, married, and she has 4 children. Two of her children are independent and the other two are 29 and 9 years of age. She has a car which is driven by a driver and she pay him 30% of what he earns every day. She wants to invest this loan it maintenance repairs to her vehicle. The driver had an accident and it is now in the mechanics shop. It needs body work and painting. She requires the funds to drive her vehicle out of the mechanics shop and to keep it working. She requests a loan to invest in paying for the repairs of her car, including body and paint work.
She is thankful for the loan and she is committed to making her payments according to the established time intervals.

loan.use: to invest in the repairs of her car

loan.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a thirty-year-old married woman with three school-going children. Her husband, John Mtiria, is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.
Gladys has operated a boutique for the past ten months. In addition, she owns a retail shop. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces the major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of new clothes and cosmetics for her business. She decided to join Yehu because of the easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loan.use: To purchase bundles of new clothes and cosmetics for her business.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: purchase one cow and two calves

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy ingredients such as wheat flour, sugar, and cooking fat

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy vegetables, green maize, and fruits to add to her business

loan.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal HATUN RUMIYOC; El banco est ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Victoria; ella tiene 57 aos D. edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. tortas y galletas, ella prepara tortas y bocaditos para diferentes eventos como matrimonios, cumpleaos entre otros compromisos, ella es propietaria D. un local que atienD. desD. las 9:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. tortas y bocaditos.
