Porfirio was born in the city of Cusco (in Peru) and is 51 years old. He is married and has two children. Today, Porfirio lives in the same town where he was born. Porfirio works in civil construction and has a family business that sells foodstuffs. It's been two years already that he's been working in this business, and it is going very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.
At this time, Porfirio is requesting the loan to purchase merchandise such as rice, sugar and much more. The member is a responsible and hard-working man, and it is for these qualities that his colleagues invited him to join the "Chaska Nawi" community bank of the Arariwa Association.

loan.use: to buy merchandise, for example rice, sugar, and much more.

loan.name: Silverio

texts.es: El seor Silverio conviviente ms de 8 aos con la seora Ninfa , ambos con una instruccin de nivel primaria, tienen 3 hijos dependientes, la familia radica en la comunidad de Duraznos Pampa hacia el norte de Colomi hace 8 aos atrs. El seor Silverio y su esposa son agricultores anualmente venden papa y locoto en la feria semanal de Colomi, como tambin cuentan con un vehculo que lo utilizan para el traslado a su fuente laboral, motivo ellos quieren mejorar la produccin agrcola y necesitan un crdito, se tuvo la iniciativa de pasar por la zona para otorgarle el prstamo que necesitaban el sr. Silverio y la sra. Ninfa.
texts.en:
Silverio has lived for more than 8 years with his partner, Ninfa, and they have 3 children together. Both Silverio and Ninfa have a grade school education. They have lived in the Duraznos Pampa community, north of Colomi, for 8 years.
Silverio and his wife are farmers. They sell potatoes and peppers at the weekly market in Colomi. Since they have a vehicle that they can use to transport their merchandise, they would like to increase their agricultural production. That is why they are requesting a loan to buy additional supplies.

loan.use: to buy supplies for his agricultural work.

loan.name: Isalita

texts.en: Isalita is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Isalita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages. Isalita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Medelita

texts.en: Medelita is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Medelita has a shop where she sells different varieties of dried fish. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more stock of dried fish to sell. Medelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Medelita hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy stocks of dried fish to sell.

loan.name: Brenda Aracely

texts.es: La seora Brenda Aracely es una mujer muy emprendedora que les gusta el negocio por tal motivo pens en poner venta de ropa usada en una de las colonias de la ciudad, el cual se podra desarrollar como una buena negociante. Con el negocio ya tiene 3 aos ofreciendo a su clientela una buena atencin, un mejor servicio y variedad de estilos de ropa. Desde que comenz su negocio comenz a dar resultados por lo que sigui adelante ya que seria la forma de tener un ingreso extra aparte del que perciba por su esposo que trabaja como jefe de maquinas en una maquiladora de la ciudad. Brenda necesita comprar ropa de temporada de invierno, por que en este momento ya sus clientes le estn solicitando y ve que es una buena oportunidad de tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Brenda Aracely is a very enterprising woman who likes business. For this reason she thought of selling used clothing in one of the districts of the city. This would cause her to develop into a good businesswoman. She's had the business for three years already, offering her customers attentiveness, better service, and a variety of styles of clothing. Ever since she started her business it began to pay off, and so she went ahead with it since it would be a way to have extra income--apart from what her husband earns as chief engineer at an assembly plant in the city. Brenda needs to buy winter clothing because her customers are already asking for it now and she sees that it's a good opportunity to have higher profits.

loan.use: to buy winter clothing.

loan.name: Severina

texts.en: Severina is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated. Severina has a shop where she sells snacks, canned goods and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Severina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Severina hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, tiene 63 aos, es una mujer alegre y entusiasta, casada vive con su esposo, sus dos hijos mayores y dos nietos menores D. edad, vive en su casa propia la cual compr con el apoyo D. su esposo. Rosa D. dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en su bodega, negocio que lo tiene instalado en su propia casa, y ahora es muy concurrida por los vecinos. A todos atienD. con amabilidad, su bodega lleva ya 4 aos D. funcionamiento, tiempo en cual ha llegado a ser muy conocida y concurrida, contando adems con el apoyo D. su esposo para la atencin al publico. Lo que le gusta D. su trabajo es que se hizo muy conocida en la zona y poder apoyar dndole la facilidad a sus vecinos D. poder adquirir sus productos D. primera necesidad cerca a sus casas y no tener que realizar largos tramos para poder adquirir estos productos. Tiene muchas ganas D. seguir creciendo en su rubro y ampliar su negocio. Este ser su tercer crdito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo D. cada uno D. ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, comprar productos variados al por mayor para surtir su bodega, ya que as podr tener mayor margen D. ganancias.
texts.en: Rosa is 63 years old. She is a happy and enthusiastic woman who is married and lives with her husband, her 2 adult children, and 2 young grandchildren. She lives in her own home, which she bought with her husband. Rosa has a grocery store that she set up in her own home. The business is now very popular with the neighbors. She attends to everyone with friendliness, and her store has been in business for 4 years. Over time, the store has become very well known and busy, and she also counts on the help of her husband to serve the public. What she likes about her work is that it has maD. her well known in the area, and she is able to help out her neighbors by giving them credit so that they can buy their necessities near their home. This way, they don't have to travel long distances to be able to acquire the products they need. She has a strong desire to continue to grow in her line of work and expand her business. This will be her third loan with MFP, and so she awaits the support of each one of you. With the sum requested, she will buy a variety of products at wholesale to stock her store, since in this way she will have better earnings.

loan.use: to buy grocery products at wholesale

loan.name: Francisco

texts.es: El seor Francisco es casado con la seora Gabriela hace 16 aos, tienen 4 hijos dependientes que estn estudiando en nivel primario y secundario, viven ms de 32 aos en la comunidad de Cayarani hacia el norte de Colomi. El seor Francisco V. tuvo la oportunidad de solicitar un prstamo para compra de abono orgnico (gallinaza) ya que a otras entidades le quedo muy lejos y le pidieron muchos requisitos. El seor Francisco y su esposa se sienten felices por haber conseguido el dinero que ms necesitaban, ahora sembrara lo ms antes ya que tena guardado semilla de papa y le estaba faltando fertilizante orgnico, tambin nos dice para el ao que viene tendr mejores condiciones de vida siempre apoyando en su estudio de su hijos y que salgan profesionales para que tengan un futuro mejor.
texts.en: Francisco has been married to Gabriela for 16 years and they have 4 children who are studying in primary and secondary school. They have lived in the Cayarani community, north of Colomi, for more than 32 years. Francisco has requested a loan in order to buy organic fertilizer. He and his wife are very happy to have received the money that they needed and they will plant more crops than before. They had stored potato seeds instead of planting them because they didn't have organic fertilizer. This will help improve the quality of their lives in the coming year and support the studies of their children so they can become professionals and have a better future.

loan.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loan.name: Purcita

texts.en: Purcita is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. Purcita has a seafood shop where she sells products like squid and octopus. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more seafood like squid and octopus to sell. Purcita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Purcita hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy seafood products like squid and octopus.

loan.name: Juan

texts.es: El Seor Juan, es una persona bien conocida y trabajadora por su zona, es soltero y no tiene hijos, es un hermano ejemplar, su madre y el educan a sus 4 hermanos, el se dedica al cultivo de platano de freir en la localidad de mariposas, su mercado es netamente local y su competencia es muy creciente, actualmente sus ingresos le sirven para poder sobrevivir, su madre es una persona mayor por lo cual no puede trabajar por lo consiguiente el es el nico sustento de su familia, Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un prstamo de nuestra institucin cuyo destino ser la compra de Plantines de pia, para contar con una variedad de productos y as poder generar un mas ingresos y mejorar la vida que tiene el y su familia
texts.en:
Juan is well known in his community and his a very hard worker. He is single and does not have any children but he is an exemplary brother. He and his mother care for his 4 brothers. He grows plantains, his customer base is extremely local and his competition is growing. Juan's current incomes supports his family and allows them to survive, since his mother is older and unable to work.
This is the first time Juan has requested a loan, which he will use to buy pineapple plants in order to diversify his products. In this way he hopes to increase his income so that he can improve his family's life.

loan.use: to buy pineapple seedlings.

loan.name: Crisanta

texts.en: Crisanta is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Crisanta provides transportation, or habal-habal, services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy tools and gasoline. Crisanta has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Crisanta hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy tools and gasoline.

loan.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Ester has a shop where she sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy more fish to sell. Ester has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Ester hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy fish to sell.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

loan.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is married with children. She is 53 years old and lives in Sebasi, Clarin Misamis Occidental. Narcisa raises pigs for sale to earn a living. She has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000. She has requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase additional pigs to sell. She has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Narcisa hopes to expand and improve her business to support their daily needs.
About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loan.use: to purchase additional pigs to sell.

loan.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Pacita has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages. Pacita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Pacita hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Marivic buys and sells clothing, towels and bed sheets. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy additional stock of clothing and towels to sell. Marivic has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marivic hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy stocks of clothing and towels for sale.

loan.name: Flora

texts.es: La seora Flora, tiene 40 aos es madre de tres hijos en edades escolares, su esposo trabaja en su propio taller de tornera, su vivienda y pequea granja estn ubicadas en la maica chica a tres kilmetros de la ciudad est mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de su granja, necesita capital de inversin para comprar cscara de soya para sus vacas asimismo est terminando unos comederos para su ganado.
texts.en: Sra. Flora, 40, is the mother of three school-aged children. Her husband works in the machine shop that he owns. Her house and farm are in La Maica Chica, some three kilometers from the city. To improve her standard of living, she is looking for investment capital that she will use to make improvements to her farm. She plans to buy feed troughs and cattle feed.

loan.use: to buy feed and feed troughs for cattle business.

loan.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married. She has four children. Marilyn is 45 years old and she lives in Guba, Clarin Misamis Occidental.
Marilyn sells candies, sugar, salt, noodles, rice and corn grits,can goods and other to earn a living and has had this business for 13 years. Each month, she earns 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional goods to sell for her store. Marilyn has been a member of GDMPC this year only. In the future, Marilyn striving hard for the education of her children because she has two daughter now in college and she want to continue renovate her house. She is hoping that her business will give return doubled.

loan.use: to purchase additional goods to sell for her store

loan.name: Cayo

texts.es: EL SEOR CAYO , es una persona de 32 aos de edad, de estado civil casado, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, y cuenta con tres dependientes econmicos a cargo los cuales son sus hijos. La actividad econmica del cliente y su esposa es netamente la produccin agrcola y los principales productos que cultiva y comercializa son la papa y haba en estado verde; la siembra de estos cultivos los realiza aproximadamente en una superficie cultivable de 2.5 Has. en sus propias parcelas heredadas de sus padres que se hallan situadas en la comunidad de Huaylla Pujru del municipio de Traque que esta distante a unos 74 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. El seor Cayo y su esposa manifiestan ser personas trabajadores y responsables que quieren superarse e incrementar su produccin agrcola y para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversin para la compra de abono de gallinaza y semilla de papa y de tal forma poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus dependientes.
texts.en: Sr. Cayo, 32, and his wife have three children. He has a primary school education. He's a farmer and his main crops are potatoes and green beans. The farm covers a cultivable area of 2.5 hectares (or a little more than 6 acres). He inherited the farm from his parents. The farm is in Huaylla Pujru, a rural community in Tiraque, some 74 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba. Sr. Cayo and his wife are hard-working and responsible people who want to improve their standard of living. To do so, they plan to increase their output, a plan for which they need investment capital to buy chicken manure (for fertilizing the land) and seeds for their next potato crop. The investment will allow Sr. Cayo to improve the quality of life of all those who depend on him.

loan.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loan.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
Rose is making and peddling snacks like banana cakes, banana cues and pancakes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.
Rose has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rose hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

loan.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married. She has two children. Jocelyn is 34 years old and she lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Jocelyn sells soft drinks, biscuits, sugar, salt, noodles, rice and spices to earn a living. She has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 6,800 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work.
She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional stock for her store. Jocelyn has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Jocelyn hope to improve her business so that she can support her two children by sending them to school.

loan.use: to purchase additional stock for her store.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy stock from Natasha and Avon.

loan.name: Ledie Claire

texts.en: Ledie Claire is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Ledie Claire has a food shop where she sells barbecue and hotdog kebabs. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients for her business. Ledie Claire has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Ledie Claire hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy raw ingredients for barbecue and hotdog sales.

loan.name: Juana

texts.es: La Seora Juana tiene 38 aos, casado con el Sr. Juan Vallejos Alvarado cuentan 2 hijos menores dependientes , viven en la comunidad de San Isidro a 36 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la seora Juana realiza colchones de paja en la misma comunidad, es una persona humilde trabajadora, necesita dinero para pagar del anticrtico de un cuarto de su hijo que esta estudiando en Sacaba, Para ella es muy difcil acudir a los Bancos de la ciudad que les piden muchos requisitos, CIDRE IFD presta servicios en la zona y oferta crditos, la Sra. Juana Rodrguez esta muy contento de haber conseguido un prstamo de nuestra Institucin ahora va pagar del anticrtico de un cuarto y ya no pagara alquiler y poder ahorrar dinero para hacer estudiar a sus dos hijos.
texts.en: Sra. Juana, 38, and her husband, Sr. Juan Vallejos Alvarado, have 2 young children. They live in the town of San Isidro, some 36 kilometers from Cochabamba. Sra. Juana makes straw mattresses for a living. She's applying for a loan to pay for an "anticretico" arrangement (a pre-paid rental contract common in Bolivia) for her son who is going to school in Sacaba. She can't borrow from banks in the city because they have many requirements that she can't easily meet. CIDRE IFD provides loans in the area. Sra. Juana is very happy with our Institution's lending arrangements because she can save the money that she would have had to pay in rent by paying for the room "anticretico" now. She can use the money she will save over the term of the "anticretico" to pay for her children's educations.

loan.use: to pay for a room for her son who is studying in another town.

loan.name: Inocencia

texts.en: Inocencia is married with seven children. She is 71 years old and lives in Clarin Misamis, Occidental. Inocencia sells soft drinks, biscuits, sugar, salt, noodles, rice and spices to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,980. She has requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase additional stock for her store. Inocencia has been a member of GDMPC for six years. In the future Inocencia hopes to improve her business so that she can support her grandchildren by sending them to school.

loan.use: to purchase additional goods to sell.

loan.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad is married with eleven children. She is 60 years old and lives in Calabayan, Clarin Misamis Occidental. Trinidad sells various kinds of banana to earn a living and has had this business for nine years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000. She has requested a loan of 7,000 to purchase fertilizer for her farm. Trinidad has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future Trinidad hopes to improve her business so that she can give moral support to her children.

loan.use: to purchase additional fertilizers for her farm.

loan.name: Tomas

texts.es: El Sr. Tomas tiene 30 aos de edad conviviente con la Sra. Bertha hace 15 aos tienen 4 hijos viven en la comunidad de Iluri Grande a 42 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, el sr. Tomas y su esposa son agricultores producen papa, haba, arveja en su parcela de terreno de Has 2 con rotacin de cultivo para ampliar el cultivo en mayor extensin necesita mas capital, los ahorros que tenia invertido en la compra de un lote de terreno para vivienda para ellos acudir a los Bancos de la ciudad es muy lejos adems le piden muchos requisitos. El sr.Tomas esta muy contento de haber conseguido un crdito para aumentar sus ingresos econmicos asi tendr ahorro para construir su vivienda en el rea urbana, para que sus hijos estudian en Colomi.
texts.en:
Tomas is 30 years old and has been living together with Bertha for 15 years and they have 4 children. They live in the community of Iluri Grande some 42 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.
Tomas and his wife are farmers growing potatoes, beans, and peas in their two hectares of land and in order to expand the rotation of their crops they need more capital. They have invested their savings that they had into the purchase of a piece of land for housing.
The city banks are far away and they have many requirements. Tomas is very happy to have been given a loan in order to increase his income so he will have savings in order to build his house in the urban area in order for his children to go to school in Colomi.

loan.use: to put capital from the loan into his agricultural activities

loan.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Yolanda has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional canned goods, snacks and beverages. Yolanda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Yolanda hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Alicia

texts.es: LA SEORA Alicia, es una persona de 27 aos de edad, de estado civil soltera, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, vive actualmente con su madre que es una persona de la tercera edad y cuenta con un solo dependiente econmico la cual es su hija. La actividad econmica de la cliente es la produccin agrcola y los principales productos que cultiva son la papa, trigo y cebada en sus terrenos propios y en las de su madre que estn ubicadas en la comunidad de Cebada Jichana del municipio de Traque que esta distante a unos 65 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. La seora Alicia manifiesta ser una persona trabajadora y responsable que quiere superarse e incrementar su produccin agrcola y para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversin para la compra de abono de gallinaza y semilla de papa y de tal forma poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus dependientes
texts.en: Alicia is a 27 year old person who is single. She has a primary school education and lives with her mother, who is elderly. She has one financial dependent, which is her daughter. This client's economic activity is agriculture and the main products she grows are potatoes, wheat and barley. She plants on her own land and on her mother's, located in the community of Cebada Jichana in the town of Traque, which is 65 Km from the city of Cochabamba. Alicia has shown herself to be a hardworking and responsible person who wants to get ahead and increase her agricultural production. For that she needs to ask for investment capital to buy chicken manure fertilizer and potato seed. In this way, she will improve her and her dependents quality of life.

loan.use: to buy chicken manure fertilizer and potato seed.

loan.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia tiene 31 aos, es una mujer luchadora con ganas de ser una gran empresaria, es madre soltera y vive en casa de sus padres en compaa de sus cuatro hermanos, su pequea hija a quien adora y se esfuerza por darle lo mejor y que no le falte nada en esta vida. El trabajo de Patricia consiste en la elaboracin y venta de productos lcteos como queso, yogurt, para lo cual cra vacas en el terreno de sus padres. Dedicada 10 aos a esta actividad, le han servido para ganar experiencia en su rubro, dedicndose ntegramente y contando con el apoyo de sus hermanos y asu vez contrata peones de la zona. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener un ingreso para poder mantener la economa de su casa, trabajando arduamente y sacar adelante a su hija y hermanos. Viendo que tiene mucha demanda los productos pues tiene pedidos pendiente por atender, espera poder seguir creciendo y agradece la oportunidad brindada en el otorgamiento de su prstamo solicitado. Este ser el quinto crdito con la institucin MFP, se siente cmoda y conforme con el grupo que conforma, siente que son personas responsables y ella tambin se compromete a ser puntual con sus pagos para poder seguir contando con el apoyo de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, comprar frutas y envases para la elaboracin de yogurt as como alambres para su cerco donde cra sus vacas.
texts.en: 31 year old Patricia is a hardworking woman who aims to be successful businesswoman. She is a single mother and lives with her parents, her four brothers, and her young daughter who she adores. Patricia strives to give her daughter the best and to make sure she is lacking for nothing. Patricia makes and sells dairy products such as cheese and yoghurt, and for this she raises cows on her parents' land. She has dedicated 10 years to this business and has gained a lot of experience in this sector. She has devoted herself to the work and has had the support of her brothers and has hired local laborers. What she likes about the work is that it enables her to have an income with which to support the household while she works hard and brings up her daughter and brothers. Being as there is considerable demand for her products and she has pending orders to attend to, she hopes to continue growing and is grateful for the opportunity offered to her by having this loan granted. This will be her 5th loan from the institution MFP, and she feels comfortable with the group she is a member of. She thinks they are responsible people and she also promises to be punctual with her repayments so that she can continue to have your support. She will use the sum of money requested to buy fruit and containers for making yoghurt and also wire fence for the yard where she raises her cows.

loan.use: to buy fruits, containers, and wire to secure her cowshed.

loan.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children.
Wilma has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON.
Wilma has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Wilma hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy stock from NATASHA and AVON.

loan.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children.
Marissa has a shop that sells a variety of dried fish. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stock of dried fish to sell.
Marissa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marissa hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy stock of dried fish to sell.

loan.name: Bryan

texts.en: Bryan is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single with two children. Bryan is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for two years. He requested a loan for 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service. Bryan has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Bryan hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

loan.name: Anita

texts.es: Anita, de 44 aos de edad, es una mujer luchadora, alegre y muy dinmica, esta casada, vive en su casa propia con su esposo, sus padres y sus dos hijos, quienes estudian en la universidad para forjarse un futuro mejor. El trabajo que realiza Anita es el alquiler de cabinas de internet, donde tiene seis computadoras bien instaladas y siendo muy concurrido ya que es la nica por la zona. Su negocio est instalado en un local acondicionado en su propia casa, el cual viene funcionando desde hace seis aos, tiempo que le ha valido para hacerse muy conocida. Asimsmo cuenta con el apoyo de un ayudante que contrata por las tardes, ya que por las maanas le apoya su hija. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener ingreso econmico regular para el sostn de la economa familiar y poder pagar los estudios superiores de sus hijos, que la llena de orgullo es que tiene gran demanda del servicio que ofrece, por ello desea poder ampliar y crecer su negocio. Este sera el crdito nmero con MFP, y se siente muy contenta por el grupo al cual est integrada, pues considera que son personas puntuales y eso le grandes nimos de seguir trabajando. Con el dinero solicitado, comprar teclados de computadoras, mouse, cables de internet y dems accesorios para las computadoras, pues nos comenta que por el uso continuo los actuales ya estn malogrndose.
texts.en: 44 year old Anita is a hardworking woman, cheerful, and very dynamic. She is married and lives in her own house with her husband, her parents, and their two children who are studying at the university so that they can forge themselves a better future. Anita runs an internet cafe and has 6 well set-up computers and she is very busy because hers is the only intent cafe in the area. Her business is run from an air-conditioned unit in her own house, and she has had the business for 6 years and has become very well known in this time. She is supported by one helper who works during the afternoons, and her daughter helps her in the mornings. What she likes about her business is that is enables her to have a regular income to support her family and to pay for her children's education. It fills her with pride that there is so much demand for the service she offers, so she wants to grow and extend her business. She is very content with the loan group that she is a member of and thinks they are punctual people and this gives her great encouragement to keep working. She will use the requested loan to buy computer keyboards, mice, internet cables, and other computer accessories because the continuous use is wearing out the current accessories.

loan.use: to buy keyboards, mice, internet cables, and other PC accessories.

loan.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with nine children.
Emelyn has a shop where she sells wood & coco charcoal by the sack. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy raw materials needed to make charcoal.
Emelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Emelyn hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy raw materials needed for making charcoal

loan.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is married with two children. Rosita is 56 years old and lives in Nailon Tudela, Misamis Occidental.
Rosita owns and manage a restaurant to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase additional food ingredients for her restaurant and other restaurant equipment.
Rosita has been a member of GDMPC for six years. In the future, Rosita hopes to improve and expand her business so that they can fulfill the dreams of her children.

loan.use: to purchase additional food ingredients for her restaurant.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy some piglets for raising.

loan.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. She has a poultry house and sells grown chickens. She has had this business for 15 years.
She requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy chicken feed for the chickens. Elvie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy chicken feed for the chickens.

loan.name: Eugenio

texts.en:
Eugenio is married and has 7 children. He is 58 years of age, and he lives in Canibungan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He raises bananas to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, he earns about PHP 8,500 doing this type of work.
He has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers for his farm. Eugenio has been a member of GDMPC for 4 years. In the future he hopes to improve his business so that he can give a brighter future to his children.

loan.use: to purchase additional fertilizers.

loan.name: Melanio

texts.en: Melanio is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. He has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Melanio has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Melanio hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Ester has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Ester has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is widow with 3 children. She is 51 years old and lives in Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Arlene owns store to earn a living and she has had this business for 4 years. Each month, she earns about PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to have additional capital for her store. Arlene has been a member of GDMPC for 1 year. In the future, she hopes to improve her small business so that she can build her own house.

loan.use: to have additional capital for her store.

loan.name: Jernalyn

texts.en: Jernalyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. Jernalyn buys and sells grown pigs and goats. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs and goats. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs and goats.

loan.name: Adelfa

texts.en: Adelfa is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Adelfa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. She has a shop that sells firewood. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of firewood to sell. Corazon has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy stocks of firewood to sell.

loan.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. She has a shop that sells a variety of dried fish. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of dried fish to sell. Virginia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy stocks of dried fish to sell.

loan.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children.
Perla is providing motorela or habal-habal services. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.
Perla has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Perla hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service

loan.name: Dorotea

texts.en:
Dorotea is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children.
Dorotea has a shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.
Dorotea has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Dorotea hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy fish to sell

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase construction materials

loan.name: Maria Pamela

texts.en:
Maria is married with 4 children. Maria is 40 years of age and she lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental.
Maria owns and manages a shop to earn a living and has had this business for 25 years. Each month she earns 20,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 26,385 PHP to purchase additional materials for her shop.
Maria has been a member of GDMPC for 4 years. In the future, Maria hopes to build another shop.

loan.use: to purchase additional materials for her shop

loan.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a widow with 7 children. Pacita is 66 years old and lives in Purok 6 Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental.
Pacita sells copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production) to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month she earns 3,425 PHP doing this type of work. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP use to renovates her copra dryer behind her. The copra here in the Philippines is dried by putting it in the "landahan" and have fire in the bottom. Behind Pacita that is locally called "landahan" or dryer
Pacita has been a member of GDMPC for 7 years. Pacita do her very best to improve her business and save portion of her profit because she wants to have electricity in her home.

loan.use: to renovate of her copra dryer

loan.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey is 46 years old, married, and has operated his restaurant for almost 20 years. Early in the morning, he cooks and prepares daily meals to sell in his restaurant. He operates his food stall at the nearby school cooking suitable meals for the students. In this kind of business, he usually generates an income of about P20,000 each month. The profits earned go for school fees for his two children. Other parts of the income are used as revolving capital for the business and enable him to continuously operate the business.
He is now requesting an additional capital of P30,000 to buy pork meat, vegetables, sugars, cooking oil, onions and garlic as ingredients in cooking meals to sell in his restaurant.
Jeffrey would like to prepare more food to sell and keep making better sales to save enough money for the education of his children. He wants to continuously provide a good education for them so that someday they will find good employment.

loan.use: to buy pork meat, vegetables, sugars, cooking oil, onions and garlic as ingredients in cooking meals to sell.

loan.name: Russel Ann

texts.en: Rusell Ann is married but has no child. She is 31 years old and she is located in Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and manages a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns about PHP 10,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional stocks for her store. She has been a member of GDMPC for 3 years. In the future, Rusell Ann hopes to improve her sari sari store so that she can support the daily needs of her sisters and brothers.

loan.use: to purchase additional stocks for her store.

loan.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeun, 52, lives in a common law relationship and has five children. She is a local farmer from Kompong Chhnang province. She tills a parcel of land for growing rice crops. She makes an annual profit from her business. Mrs. Oeun plans to expand into additional farmland for more income. However, she does not have sufficient capital to achieve her purpose. She said, Ill be able to generate the rice production at a high rate with my experience, and then I can keep it for daily food as well as sell it for money.
Mrs. Oeun has applied for a loan from Kiva through HKL to buy extra farmland and mineral fertilizers to provide crop maintenance to her rice crops. The loan will be of much help for her to be able to invest in her rice crops.

loan.use: to buy extra farmland and mineral fertilizers.

loan.name: Ernel

texts.en:
Due to the lack of job opportunities, Ernel is engaged in a rice farming business to earn income and support his family's needs. He is now 35 years old and has two school-age children. As a responsible father, he aims to uplift their status of living and give the children a bright future. In this regard, he endures hardships and difficulties, for he wants to increase his income to satisfy their basic needs and to finance the education of the children.
Due to inadequate capital, he is asking for a loan of P35,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the maintenance of his rice farming business. He believes that through his patience and hard work, he will increase his yields and income this coming harvest season.

loan.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his rice farming business.

location.town: Brgy. Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loan.name: Ullyses

texts.en:
Ullyses is single but has 1 child. He is 29 years old and he lives in Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He has a small motor repair shop to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, he earns about PHP 6,000 doing this type of work.
He has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional materials for his shop. He has been a member of GDMPC for 4 years. In the future, he hopes for success in his small business so that he can support the education of his only daughter.

loan.use: to purchase additional material for his shop.

loan.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Rosemarie helps her husband in planting root crops (taro) in their village to generate additional income. She is 43 years old and has four school-age children. They aim to continue sending their children to school for they want them to earn a degree and becomes professionals in the future. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, they need to increase their income to acquire their needs and finance the education of their children.
In this regard, Rosemarie is asking for additional capital of P10,000 to buy seedlings and fertilizers for the maintenance of their root crop production. She hopes that through this loan, they will increase their production and their income and satisfy their family needs.

loan.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers for the maintenance of their root crop production.

loan.name: Wilbeth

texts.en:
Wilbeth is a hardworking mother. She devotes herself to selling fruits and vegetables to the people in her village. She has been in this business for almost two years. She usually earns about P2,000 each month. She is a single parent. She needs to generate income to save for the education of her child.
She is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy cabbages, eggplant, tomatoes and fish to sell in her stall. This will help increase the number of sales from her business and thus boost up her profits.
In the future, she would like to keep making better sales and achieve financial stability to improve her living conditions.

loan.use: to buy cabbages, eggplant, tomatoes and fish to sell in her stall.

loan.name: Fortunineza

texts.en: Fortunineza is single. She is 22 years of age and she located at Barangay Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She sells snacks in the community to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns about PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to use as additional capital for her store. She has been a member of GDMPC for 5 years. In the future, Fortunineza hopes to build her own store.

loan.use: to use as additional capital for her store.

loan.name: Arnelyn

texts.en: Arnelyn is married with 1 child. She is 26 years old and lives in Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She sells canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, candies and noodles to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns about PHP 3,200 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional stock for her store. She has been a member of GDMPC for 3 years. In the future, Arnelyn hopes to improve her business so that she can have her own store.

loan.use: to purchase additional stock for her store.

loan.name: Apollo

texts.en:
At the age of 19, Apollo got married. He did not have the chance to enter college because his parents had no capacity to send him to school. At that time, Apollo was helping his parents in doing activities in farming. He also helped his parents in managing their small livestock business. He was also not given a chance to work because his education level is low. He learned from his family how to manage a hog raising business.
Now, Apollo is 41 years old. He is happy living with his wife and four children. When his wife went abroad, Apollo determined to start up a hog raising business. He is happy that his business has been running for almost 11 years up to the present. His hog raising business serves as a source of income for him, and his profits mostly went to his children's allowances in school and to household expenses.
Apollo wants to develop his business, so he is requesting a loan of P15,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs. He hopes to maintain the business and develop through the loan he requested. It will also be a big help for him to maintain his source of income and further bestow his family's necessities.

loan.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loan.name: March

texts.en: March is 35 years old, and works in a shoe factory where she earns $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker earning $2.5 per day. They have one child who is 10 years old and in school. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on house rent, $2 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work. She wants to buy a cow to feed, and get its baby to sell when she has enough money.

loan.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work

loan.name: Sokheng

texts.en: Sokheng is a garment factory worker earning $2 per day. Her husband has a small shop to do electronic repairs from which he earns $6 per day. They have two children, one is studying and the other is too young to go to school. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $6 on electricity, $20 on house rent, $3 on school fees, and $7 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy equipment for electrical repairs to help her husbands career. This loan will help her husband to have enough equipment that can provide better service to his customers. The couple plans to extend their shop and wants to open an electric repairing school so that they can make other income.

loan.use: To buy equipment for electrical repairs to help her husband's career.

loan.name: Sophart

texts.en: Sophart is 53 years old and a farmer. He sells animals and earns $10 per day. His wife is a farmer, and sells fish earning $10 per day. They have three children; one is studying, and the other two are working earning $10 per day each. Every month, he has to spend $61 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $5 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy cow for farming and to sell. He doesn't want to change his career of selling cows because he can make good income from this career.

loan.use: To buy cow for farming and to sell

loan.name: On

texts.en:
On, pictured in the photo, and her husband, Bunthoeun, are farmers. When she is not at the farm, she also buys nets, silk, cotton fabric, scarves, and hammocks and resells them in her village.
The couple has been married for almost ten years, and has four children; three sons and one daughter. Three are in school, and the other one is still young. They live in a village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
On hopes to continue her business, so she decided to apply for another loan in the mount of $1,000 to buy addition nets, silk, cotton fabric, scarves, and hammocks for sale.

loan.use: To buy additional nets, silk, cotton fabric, scarves, and hammocks for sale.

loan.name: Siby

texts.en: Siby is 42 years old and is a grocery seller earning $7 per day. Her husband buys and sells fruit earning $3 per day. They have four children, one is studying and the rest are helping their mother sell grocery goods. Every month she has to spend $66 on food, $3 on electricity, $4 on school fees, $3 on transportation, and $7 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy fruit to sell. She wants to extend her husbands business so he can make good profit from his business.

loan.use: To buy fruit to sell.

loan.name: Sam Ang

texts.en:
Sam Ang (in the photo) is 51-years-old and her husband, Sras, is 50 years old. They live in a village about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1980 and have four children; two sons and two daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, one is an electrician, another one is garment worker and another one attends school.
Sam Ang and her husband raise fish at home. She is asking for her first loan of $500 to help wither her fish farming business by buying fish feed.

loan.use: to buy fish feed.

loan.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy, 41-years-old, is a housewife. Her husband is a worker and earns $4 per day. They have four children; three are working and each earns $3 per day and one more is only one-year-old.
Every month she has to spend $78 on food, and $10 on other expense. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy yams to sell.
Before, her husband used to hire workers to plant a bean plantation but he lost his crop because of too much rain. Now he does not plant but instead buys the vegetables or fruits to sell because it is not as high risk and he can make a better income.

loan.use: to buy yams to sell.

loan.name: Sokhan

texts.en:
Sokhan (pictured here), and her husband, Thuok, have been married since 1994 and have two daughters who are in school. The family lives on an island in the MeK. River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
Sokhan now sells pickled fruit in her village. Her husband is a farmer who grows vegetable. He hopes to continue his vegetable farming. Thus, Sokhan is applying for another loan of $200 to support her husbands work by buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loan.use: to help supply her husband with the capital to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loan.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 59, married and has four adult children. She owns and manages a variety store in their village to supplement her husband's income. Despite the hardships and difficulties in life, they aim to uplift their status of living and give their children a better future. She aims to strengthen her variety store to earn a higher income and satisfy their necessities.
To improve the business, she is asking for an additional capital of P7,000 to buy soft drinks, junk foods, breads, beverages, noodles and seasonings to sell. She hopes that this loan will help a lot to improve her variety store. She hopes that in the future, she will make the business grow and profitable.

loan.use: to buy soft drinks, junk foods, breads, beverages, noodles and seasonings to sell.

loan.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng (in the photo) is a weaver. She is a widow with seven children - three sons and four daughters. Three are married and live outside the family home, two are house constructors, one is a horse cart driver and another one is in school. The family is living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
Seng is asking for a loan of $500 to help with her son who is a horse cart driver by buying one more horse.

loan.use: to help with her sons business of driving a horse cart by purchasing one more horse.

loan.name: Chhun Eng

texts.en:
Chhun Eng and her husband, Sokun, are silk weavers. They have been married since 1990, and they have three children -- one son and two daughters. One child is a weaver; another one is in school; and another one is still young. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City in Cambodia.
Chhun Eng is requesting another loan of $300 to continue her weaving business by purchasing silk materials.
Photo: Chhun Eng is not pictured with her loom because under her the area is flooded. She needs to move her looms to her mothers house, the same location where she lives, because that location is not affected by the flood.

loan.use: to continue her weaving business by purchasing silk materials.

loan.name: Noun

texts.en: Noun, 38 years old, is a farmer and pig seller. She earns $1.50 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns $4 per day. They have four children; two are studying and two more work in a garment factory. Each earns $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on rent/a house fee, $8 on school fees, $13 on transportation and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy pigs to feed and sell. The rest of the money she will keep for her daughter's wedding. She wants to feed more pigs so she can make a good profit at this time.

loan.use: to buy pigs to feed and sell.

loan.name: Chantha

texts.en: Chantha, 29 years old, is a garment factory worker who earns $5 per day. Her husband also works in the factory, earning $6 per day. They have two children; one is studying and one more is too small for school. Every month, she has to spend $42 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on rent/a house fee, $5 on school fees, $15 on transportation and $7 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for her and her husband, who travels to work in Phnom Penh City. In the future, she wants to sell grocery goods at home. Her husband has a motor taxi service so that they can stay home together.

loan.use: to buy a motorbike for her and her husband to travel to work.

loan.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is married and has three children. Elma is 37 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, the Philippines. Elma sells rice and corn to earn a living. She has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers for her farm.
Elma has been a member of GDMPC for six years. In the future, Elma hopes to improve and expand her business so she can support the education of her children.

loan.use: to purchase additional fertilizers for her farm.

loan.name: Basilides

texts.en:
Basilides is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. Basilides has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 25,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Basilides has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Basilides hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Koemphal

texts.en:
Koemphal (pictured in the photo) is a 40-year-old tailor. Her husband, Noeurn, is a 39-year-old construction worker. They live in a village along National Road number five, which is approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1986, and they have three children: two sons and one daughter. One child is a garment worker, one is a driver, and another is in school.

Koemphal wants to start a new business of raising chickens, so she is asking for her first loan of $500 to buy baby chickens to raise as well as chicken feed.

loan.use: To purchase baby chickens and chicken feed.

loan.name: Gnet

texts.en:
Gnet, 34 years old, is a Khmer noodle seller. She explains that she typically earns $6 per day. Her husband is a soldier, and he typically earns $1.50 per day. They have two children, both of whom are in school. Every month she spends approximately $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $15 on transportation, and $17 on other expenses.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200 to buy a machine to make Khmer noodles for re-sale purposes. This loan would enable her make more Khmer noodles to sell to her customers. She plans to expand her business so that she can have additional customers.

loan.use: To purchase a machine to make Khmer noodles.

loan.name: Vary

texts.en:
Vary (pictured in the photo), 45 years old, sells fish in Phnom Penh market. Her husband, Sarat, is a 47-year-old rice and lotus farmer. They live in a village along National Road number five, which is approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1990, and they have five children: four sons and one daughter. Three of their children are garment workers, one attends school, and another is still too young for school.

Vary is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,200 to assist with her husbands farming business. Specifically, she would like to buy a motorized hand tiller.

loan.use: To assist with her husbands farming business by purchasing a motorized tiller.

loan.name: Sheralyn

texts.en:
Sheralyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.

Sheralyn buys and sells fruits, such as mangoes and durian, with the help of her husband (pictured) as the motorcycle driver. She has been running this business for 5 years.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP to buy more fruit to deliver and sell. Sheralyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Sheralyn hopes to improve and expand her business.

loan.use: To purchase additional fruit for re-sale purposes

loan.name: Rin

texts.en:
Rin, 59 years old, is a grocery seller earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a farmer earning approximately $1 per day. They have three children, all of whom are working and earning approximately $3 per day. Every month she spends approximately $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on rent, $15 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to buy a motorbike for her children so that they can more easily travel to work. She does not want to change her business because she can earn solid profits from it.

loan.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to travel to work

loan.name: Jenelry

texts.en: Jenelry is 18 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Jenelry has vegetable garden and harvests and sells vegetables like eggplants and string beans. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy fertilizers for the vegetable garden. Jenelry has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Jenelry hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy fertilizers for the vegetable garden.

loan.name: Halimaan's Group

texts.en: Halimaan is 43 years old, married, and has seven children. She couldnt provide education to all of them due to poor financial conditions. She is very skillful and makes Pranaday, which is a very popular product among women, used to tie up hair. Her husband makes mud utensils. He has great artful hands and makes beautiful looking utensils which he sells to different shops for profits. Four of her children also work. They do different kinds of businesses to financially contribute to the family. Halimaan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her Pranaday making business. With the loan, she will buy thread and beads in larger quantities to make Paranday of different kinds (simple and beaded). She has been operating her business for many years, and is very confident that an investment will help her improve her sales and profits.

loan.use: To buy thread and beads for Paranday making business.

loan.name: Joey

texts.en: Joey is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. Joey has a shop that buys and sells fruits like durian. He has had this business for four years. He requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy stocks of fruits to sell. Joey has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Joey hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to buy stocks of fruits to sell.

loan.name: Samnag

texts.en:
Samnang (pictured here) is a mason, and lives in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, across the Mekong River. He has been married since 1990 and has five children- four sons and one daughter. One is a security guard, another one is a construction worker, two are in school, and the other one is still young.
Samnang has requested a Kiva loan to purchase a motorcycle for commuting once already. He wants to buy one more motorbike for his son who is a security guard to drive work, so he has decided to ask for another loan of $700.

loan.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his son who is a security guard to drive to work.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase woods and varnish for her furniture shop business.

loan.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina, the woman in the photo, is 32 and a chef. She cooks for a Christian NGO. Her husband, Savatdy, is 34 and a driver. They have been married since 1999 and have two daughters. One is in school; the other one is still young. They live in a village outside of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.
Sina is requesting her first loan of US $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loan.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loan.name: Nhing

texts.en: Nhing, 41 years old, is a sweet seller earning $6 per day. Her husband is a farmer and earns $1.50 per day. They have three children, all of whom are students. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $17 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for her children to use when traveling to study. She doesnt want to change her career selling sweets. She wants to support all of her children through university so that they can find a good job.

loan.use: to buy a motorbike for her children traveling to study

loan.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Raquel has a fruit stand that buys and sells different fruits, like durian. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 16,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to stock fruit to sell. Raquel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Raquel hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to stock fruit to sell

loan.name: Marylie

texts.en: Marylie is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. Marylie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Marylie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marylie hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loan.name: Hajran Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Hajran Bibi is 46 years old and married with six children: two daughters and four sons. Her daughters help Hajran in her sewing business, and her sons are in school: the eldest son reads in the 7th standard while the others read in 4th, 3rd and kindergarten.
Hajran and her daughters have done sewing for many years. They receive orders from the neighboring customers and generate income for the family. They all also manage the household chores and take care of the family by fulfilling their needs.
Hajrans husband is involved in the business of selling chickens. He supplies chickens to different butcher shops and earns a good profit every month. He has been in this business for many years.
Hajran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husbands business. With the loan, her husband will buy chickens in a larger quantity to be able to complete the orders of his customers on time and earn maximum profits.

loan.use: to buy chickens for selling.

loan.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 43 years old, married, and has three children. She sells a variety of merchandise such as cosmetics, shoes, wallets, perfumes, lotions, and clothing for kids, men, and women. She is thankful because her direct selling business is growing due to the increasing number of her customers. She has been in this line of business for two years, and earns about P 5,000 a month.
Grace would like to continue improving her business, but because of some credits, she could not buy more products. For this reason, she is asking for financial assistance in the amount of P 25,000 to purchase more products needed by her customers. Grace is also thankful because her husband is supportive in raising their children, and is also supportive of the direct selling she manages. While she's busy in selling her products house-to-house, her husband wakes up early to manage his transport motorcycle business. The couple works hard to send their children into higher level of education.

loan.use: to purchase more products for her direct selling business.

loan.name: Rowelyn

texts.en:
Rowelyn is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
Rowelyn has a vegetable garden where she harvest vegetables that she sells, like eggplants & string beans. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers for the vegetable garden.
Rowelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rowelyn hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy fertilizers for the vegetable garden.

loan.name: Jenafe

texts.en:
Jenafe is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
Jenafe has a food shop; she makes & sells home-made ice-cream. She is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy raw ingredients for home-made ice cream.
Jenafe has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jenafe hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy raw ingredients for home-made ice cream.

loan.name: Radesa

texts.en:
Radesa is married with two children. She is 36 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental.
Radesa sells bananas in the community to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month,she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers for her farm.
Radesa has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Radesa hope to improve her small business so that she can build her own house.

loan.use: to purchase additional fertilizers for her farm.

loan.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma wants to see her business grow, and thats why she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 that will make it possible for her to buy products such as coffee, sugar, soft drinks and assorted biscuits to sell. She hopes that her work will provide her with the opportunity to provide her family with better living conditions.
Gemma is engaged in a general store business. She is 46 years old, married and has been blessed with five children. For her, the best way to reach her personal goals is through dedication to her work without forgetting about being happy all the time.

loan.use: to buy products such as coffee, sugar, soft drinks and assorted biscuits to sell.

loan.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
Melinda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Melinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Melinda hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loan.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 40 years old and has been raising hogs for almost two years. She engaged herself in this business to generate income to provide a good life for her family. Irene usually earns about PHP 3,000 for each hog disposed. Profits go for her children's school fees and allowances.
Irene has insufficient funds to sustain her hogs, so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed, medicines, and vitamins for the hogs. She wants to ensure good nutrition and proper growth for her hogs. She also wants to continue growing as an entrepreneur, and someday lift her family out of poverty.

loan.use: to buy feed, medicines, and vitamins for the hogs.

loan.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 36 years old and is engaged in a hog raising business as one of her sources of income. She has been doing this for over two years and has been earning 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) per piglet. She hopes that she can get the loan she requested to further develop her business.
She is requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs and to use in her hog raising business. She hopes this will lead to growth in her business.
She devotes herself to working hard in order to support the needs of her family as well as to pay for her child's education. She hopes to provide for her child so that she can finish her education and become a degree holder someday which would help to lift their standard of living.

loan.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs

loan.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios Serran is from the village of Sto. Domingo, Alicia, Isabela. She is 47 years old. She is married and has five children. To make a living, Remedios owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month from it.
She wants to expand her family's business, which is why she is taking out this loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, biscuits, noodles and other ingredients to sell. She hopes to grow and expand her general store to secure her family's future and aims to educate her children so that they will become professionals someday. Despite the hardships of life, they are striving hard to earn and save for their children's education.

loan.use: to purchase canned goods, biscuits, noodles and other ingredients to sell

loan.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet, 40 years of age, is married and thankful because they had been blessed with one child. She has been operating a retail store in their village for almost four years. Her monthly income is 1,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) and she is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase bread, coffee, sugar, canned goods, instant noodles and soft drinks to sell.
She hopes to further expand her business to generate higher profits and to sustain her family's daily needs. She would like to continue taking out loans and hopes that Kiva lenders will extend their assistance to her in the future.

loan.use: to purchase bread, coffee, sugar, canned goods, instant noodles and soft drinks to sell

loan.name: Ameeran's Group

texts.en:
Ameeran is a 56-year-old active lady. She has some buffalo at home, whose milk she sells to her community clients. She gets up early in the morning, milks her buffalo, and then sells the milk to her clients. The quality of milk she provides to her clients is very good and she makes reasonably good profits every month.
She is the mother of four sons. Her eldest son sells animals like buffalo, goats, and sheep. Her second son operates a Punjabi food restaurant. Her third and fourth sons are also salesmen.
Ameeran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her son's animal sales business. With the loan, her son will buy goats and sheep for selling.
He has been operating his business for the past five years and Ameeran is hopeful that an investment will help him make his business more profitable.
In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Ameeran.

loan.use: To buy animals for selling

loan.name: Serina

texts.en:
Serina is married and has four children. She is 55 years old and she lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental
Serina sells rice to earn a living and had this business for seven years. Each month, she earns 4,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase more fertilizers for her farm.
Serina has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Serina hopes to improve her business so that they can help her grandchildren by sending them to school.

loan.use: to purchase more fertilizers for her farm

loan.name: Pumsen

texts.en:
Pumsen (in the photo) lives along National Road Five, about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been married since 1985 and has three children- one son and two daughters. One child is married and lives outside the family home and other two are garment workers. Her husband, Sorphorn, is a motorbike repairman.
Pumsen sells rice and food in front of the garment factory. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to a assist in her husbands motorbike repairing business by purchasing more motorbike spare parts to better respond to his customers needs.

loan.use: to assist in her husbands motorbike repair business by purchasing more motorbike spare parts to better respond his customers needs

loan.name: Teresito

texts.en: Teresito is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. Teresito has a shop that sells coconuts for copra and green bananas. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 17,000 PHP to buy coconuts and bananas to sell. Teresito has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Teresito hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to buy coconuts and bananas for sale

loan.name: Him

texts.en:
Mrs. Him is a creative woman and the mother of five children. She lives with her husband and her children in Reussey Keo commune, Phnom Penh city. Mrs. Him decided to work indoors so she can take some time to take care of her little children at home.
To earn a living, Mrs. Him cuts unnecessary thread off the clothes that are brought from the garment factory nearby. Her income depends on the amount of clothes she is able to finish. She typically earns approximately 2.5 USD each day and works hard to support her family. Her husband also helps to earn the profit for the family by selling fish, which he buys from his suppliers.
Currently, Mrs. Him needs some funds from Kiva, a partner of HKL, in order to support her husband's business. She will use this loan to buy some additional fish to sell. With the remainder of the loan, she wants to fill ground under her wooden house. It is in a low area that always suffers from water in the rainy season.
In the future, she hopes that she will be able to send her children to be educated to a high level.

loan.use: to buy some additional fish to sell

loan.name: Ilhomjon

texts.en: Ilhomjon is a resident of the Hamadoni region. He is 36 yeas old. He is married and has five children. He has been breeding large horned cattle for two years. Mainly he breeds the cattle for future resale. He breeds the cattle at home and his son helps him in this. Ilhomjon is taking out the loan to buy three heads of large horned cattle.

loan.use: to buy three heads of large horned cattle.

loan.name: Virginita

texts.en: Virginita is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. Virginita has a shop that sells a variety of dried fish. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy dried fish to sell. Virginita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Virginita hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy dried fish to sell

loan.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy (in the photo) is a tailor. Her husband, Phalla, is a rice farmer. They have been married since 1990 and have three children- two sons and one daughter. One child is a garment worker and other two are in school. The family is living along National Road Number Five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.
One of Chanthys sons is studying Information Technology at his university. Chanthy is again asking for another loan in order to continue her sons studies by paying school fees for her son and purchasing a motorbike for him to drive school.

loan.use: to pay school fees for her son and purchase a motorbike for him to drive school

loan.name: Hudson

texts.en:
Hudson is 29 years old. He is married and blessed with two children. He is a mixed (crop and livestock) farmer and has been doing this for three years. His farm is in a productive area, which is good for mixed farming.
He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET in his area of residence. This will be his first loan. He plans to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, seedlings and feed for his cattle. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to educate his children.
His dream is to educate his children. He is a scrupulous man who can do more if supported financially.

loan.use: buy farm inputs.

loan.name: Elda

texts.en: Elda is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. Elda has a shop that sells bananas and coconuts for copras. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy bananas and coconuts. Elda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Elda hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy bananas and coconuts for copras

loan.name: Hajraan's Group

texts.en:
Hajraan is 28 years old, married, and has three sons. She operates a grocery store where she sells daily-use items such as spices, sugar, rice, lentils, soaps, etc. She provides very good customer service and makes good sales.
Her husband has a bike rental business. He has some motorbikes which he rents to his customers. He charges the customers by the hour.
Hajraan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her grocery store business. With the loan, she will buy groceries in bulk that will allow her to fulfill client orders on time and increase her profits. She is confident that an investment will help her increase her household income.

loan.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loan.name: Zainabu

texts.en: Zainabu is a hardworking business woman who is 36 years old. She is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. For the last eight years, she has been selling used clothes and used shoes to earn a living. She also rents houses for more income. Previously, she was running a cafeteria. She has retained her business because of a good reputation with her customers. She has employed one person to assist her in managing the business. In the next five years, she wants to manage a wholesale business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to make a habit of saving. Zainabu has requested 40,000 KES to buy clothes and shoes for resale.

loan.use: To buy used clothes and shoes

loan.name: Kak

texts.en:
Kak is 54 years old. He and his wife Pern (53 years old and pictured with him) live along National Road Number Six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have eight children: six sons and two daughters. Three are married and live outside the family home, one is a construction worker, one sells televisions and radios, and the other three are in school.
Kak is asking for his first loan of 700 USD to buy seed, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain his farm.

loan.use: To buy seed, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain his farm.

loan.name: Sam At

texts.en:
Sam at (in the photo), 38, is a motor taxi driver. His wife, Channa, 35, is a garment worker. They have been married since 1998 and have three children-one son and two daughters. Two are in school and another one is still young. The family lives in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
Sam at wants to supplement new business investing with his neighbor to grow rice, so he is asking for his first loan $500.The money will go towards buying seed fertilizer and pesticide to maintain the rice farm.

loan.use: to buy seed fertilizer and pesticide to maintain the rice farm.

loan.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
Emelda has a shop where she sells green and yellow bananas and also coconuts for copra. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy bananas and coconuts.
Emelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Emelda hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy bananas and also coconuts for copra.
